loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old and married with one child.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Maribel aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khat's Group

texts.en:
Living a wooden house in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Khat is 30 years old.  

The main source of her family’s income is from cassava planting. She has been in this business for almost 6 years. With the current business, she can earn about 50,000KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Khat with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mardoris

texts.es:
Ella es Mardoris, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus dos hijos.
Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 3 meses en un pequeño local con muchas ganas y empuje. Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en muchos restaurantes en meses pasados y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.
Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar sillas, mesas, realizar adecuaciones locativas como trabajos de pintura, reforma, montaje de lavaplatos, comprar insumos para sus preparaciones y pagar una deuda que tiene con un tercero cuando inicio su actividad.
Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
Mardoris is a woman of good character and helpfulness, with the desire to succeed and move forward, along with her husband and their two children. Approximately three months ago, and with great enthusiasm and drive, she decided to start her business preparing and selling fast foods and selling drinks. 

She learned this occupation by working in many restaurants in the past months, and this allowed her to acquire a great deal of experience. Now she wishes to give her business a little boost, and this is why she requires a loan so that she can buy chairs, tables, make site improvements such as painting, refurbishing and setting up of a dishwasher, buy supplies for cooking, and pay a debt she has with a third-party from when she started her business. 

This is a woman who accepts challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, make site improvements, buy cooking supplies, and pay a debt to a third-party.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy a computer.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a married farmer from Taguitic, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte. He operates his garden and rice field to earn a living. In 2008, he joined GDMPC and is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for his farm. 

He hopes to gain more harvest so he can provide better living conditions for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like abaca fiber, etc. for her abaca weaving business.

Flor has been in this business for 4 years. Flor earns additional income from pig-fattening.

Flor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like abaca fiber for her business.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening.  Lea is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is 44 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Gerly works very hard to provide for them.

Gerly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell.

Gerly has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar, eggs, etc. 

Gerly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like cereals, detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, sugar and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Resel

texts.en:
Resel is 25 years old and is a married mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Resel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Resel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Resel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Resel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Jenita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jenita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 26, is a villager from Kampong Speu province. She has two children who are too young for schooling. Her main sources of income are from two hectares of rice cropping and her occupation as a teacher at a primary school. 

This is the first loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

Since she wants to pursue her bachelor degree majoring in English, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for her tuition fees and a decent computer. She hopes that she can hold a bachelor degree so she can improve her capacity to performing her job.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees and a decent computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase educational materials and buy a bicycle for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition and buy a bicycle

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia Lucila continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de leche, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Lucila continues to work in her milk-selling business.  She has been running this business for quite some time now.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort she gives to her business every day.  She wants to be able to keep working so that, in this way, she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy milk.

She is thankful for the loan that was granted and she is committed to making her established payments.

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, meats, vegetables, soft drinks, disposable utensils, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is from Zamboanga del sur, Philippines. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. In order to have her own source of income, two years ago, she started to raise pigs for sale aside from helping her husband farm. 

She is asking for her loan to buy additional piglets and feed. Her dream is to improve her business in order to have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Jaylord

texts.en:
Jaylord is a friendly and happy man who comes from the village of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 22 years old, and is married. For approximately five years now, he has run a retail business selling used shoes in town and earns well to sustain their living.

With the intent of improving his income and allowing his family to live more comfortably, he is requesting his first loan to purchase more used shoes to sell. His dream is to have a safe home with basic conditions for his children's comfort. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jewelry and pay off some personal expenses

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine vending business.

Emilda has been in this business for 5 years. Emilda earns additional income from a general store.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Rovelyn has been in this business for one year. Rovelyn earns additional income from pig-fattening and a general store.

Rovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 43 years old and married with six children.

Margie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Margie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Margie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snack foods and other groceries for her store.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married mother with six children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening and tricycle transportation. Aida is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oranges, Seville oranges, and yuca.

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Jeniveva is aged early twenties and is single. She has been managing a pharmacy for eighteen months now. Jeniveva is also involved in the business of selling sunflower during harvest season. She is doing great and working hard to improve her life. She starts doing business from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Jeniveva's first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She is applying for 2,100,000 TZS to be apportioned among Salasala, her six-member group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Jeniveva will use her portion of this loan to replenish her business with new medicine inventory. Her ambition is to greatly improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: to replenish her business with new medicine inventory.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with four children and lives in Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. 

Marilyn has been raising pigs to sell for more than four years. Raising pigs helps a lot to support her husband's income from farming. She has successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for her livestock's medication. 

She wants to improve her farm and have a greener field, so she took on a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She wants to have a better future for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Merly. She is married and has 2 children. Earlier this year, Merly established her own fish farm with the help of her husband. She began her business to enhance her regular income to have a better livelihood. Her farm is located in the village of Zamboanga del Sur and it is her main source of income.

Merly would like a loan in order to buy additional fingerlings and feeds. She hopes that this loan will help improve her status, both at home and in her business. 

In the future, Merly plans to start buying and selling freshly harvested fish in the neighboring villages.

loans.use: to buy additional fingerlings and feeds.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is married, has four children, and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He has been providing transportation in the village to earn a living. For eight years, he was able to support his family, and had successfully repaid his previous loan used to purchase tires. To improve the services, he took a new loan to purchase a rain coat and other accessories.

In the future, he wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a rain-coat and other accessories.

loans.name: Kyla

texts.en:
This is Kyla, 22, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. Single, she works hard to provide for her everyday needs. She is also helping her family financially.

Kyla operates a rolling store. Her rolling store is basically a small house-wear store, which retails plastic containers, dippers, pails plastic or basins to the local neighborhood. She would drive the rolling store within the local community to sell the products. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy home products, such as pails, brushes, scotch brite, basins, and other products needed in her business.

Kyla dreams to have her own stall and hopes to have her own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for home products, such as pails, brushes, scotch brite, basins, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chila

texts.en:
As a married parent with five children, Chila works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Chila is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers in her fish-vending business.

Chila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married mother with three children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a business manufacturing hollow blocks in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy sand and gravel for her hollow blocks.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy sand and gravel for her hollow blocks.

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elinita is 41 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Elinita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elinita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her food production business.

Elinita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Elinita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, spices, vegetables, noodles for her food production business.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid is 61 years old, a widowed mother of two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Ingrid has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ingrid requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Ingrid has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ingrid would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old. She is a married mother with eight children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marissa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig-fattening business.

Maria Fe has been in this business for 10 years. Maria Fe earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Maria Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Duena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Duena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food-vending and pig-raising. Duena is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more items to resell, such as soaps, noodles, can goods, egg, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Duena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell, such as soaps, noodles, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal and rice. Teresita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like soap, coffee, eggs, and milk.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, coffee, eggs, and milk.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, ha seguido trabajando en el cultivo de granos básicos con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior, la calidad de su producción aumento y las utilidades son mejores, su grupo familiar vive en mejores condiciones.
Esta vez decidió solicitar un nuevo crédito por la facilidad que tiene para adquirir todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para cultivar granos básicos, comprara abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas e insecticidas para dar tratamiento al terreno antes de sembrar.
texts.en:
Tomas has continued working in the cultivation of bulk grains with the help from the previous loan, the quality of his crops grew and his profits are stronger; his family circle lives in better conditions.

This time, he decided to seek a new loan due to the ease that he has in acquiring the agricultural supplies needed to grow bulk grains. He will buy fertilizers, pest-control substances, weed killer and insecticides to treat the land before sowing.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest-control substances, weed killer and insectides.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey, 37, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. She has been farming rice and growing cassava for 14 years. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Rey has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Luis es una persona emprendedora y dedicada al negocio, actualmente se dedica a la venta de embutido, carnes y lácteos hace mas de 5 años, esto lo realiza de manera ambulante, visitando todas la comunidades cercanas a su casa de habitación, el cuenta con una motocicleta en la cual lleva su producto, sus principales clientes, personas de escasos recursos que no pueden viajar a la cuidad a compra sus víveres para alimentarse.
Luis solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de carne de res, carne de cerdo, queso, mantequilla, chorizo, copetines, salchichas y otros embutidos, el sueña con tener un local en su casa de habitación para mejorar sus ingresos y así cambiar su condición de vida.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras  abril 2014
texts.en:
Luis is an enterprising person who is dedicated to his work, for the last five years he has been making a living selling sausages, meat and dairy products, going from house to house, visiting all the communities near his home. He has a motobike with which he transports the goods, his main customers are people with little financial resources who are unable to travel to the city to buy their provisions to eat.

Luis is seeking the aid of this loan to buy beef, pork, cheese, butter, drinks, sausages and other products. He dreams of having a store in his home to improve his income and therein change his situation in life.

loans.use: to buy beef, pork, cheese, butter, chorizo, drinks, sausages and others for his business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector, raising and harvesting rice to sell. Gemma sells her harvested rice commercially. 

For many years, she has earned a good income. She was able to make some improvements to her house, put up a retail store and also successfully repay her previous loan used for farming. 

Recently, Gemma took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. Gemma plans to re-invest her profits into the business, to buy more land to cultivate and to double the income she receives.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the paperwork and procedures for his wife's professional credentials.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buy-and-sell fish. Mercy is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net for the fishing maintenance of her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net for her fishing maintenance.

loans.name: Kirana

texts.en:
As a married parent of 11 children, Kirana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coated and salted peanuts. Kirana is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell in her general store.

Kirana has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Concepcion Magdalena

texts.es:
Concepción, solicita un nuevo crédito que utilizará comprar faldas, pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa interior para ambos sexos, trajes entre otras piezas que sean del gusto de sus clientes.
El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa, con la que surtió su negocio de nuevas prendas, su situación económica es más estable, ha cancelado con buen record crediticio su deuda, sigue aportando en los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción is asking for a new loan, which she will use to buy skirts, pants, shirts, tops, suits, and underwear for both sexes, among other items that are to the liking of her customers.  

She invested her previous loan in the purchase of clothing, which stocked her business with new outfits.  Her financial situation is more stable; she has paid off her debt with a good credit record.  She continues to take care of the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, shirts, tops, suits, and underwear for both men and women.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias, una de ella es la coordinadora señora María de 51 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cinco hijos de los cuales ninguno depende ella, se dedica a la venta de frijoles, tortilla y comida en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace 16 años con una liquidación que le dieron de la empresa que laboraba, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de gaseosas, maíz, arroz, frijoles, repollo, remolacha, zanahoria, fletes de leña, etc., por medio de los créditos otorgados en la institución ha conseguido aumentar las ganancias, logrando realizar mejoras a su viviendas, implementó la elaboración de venta de comida, pues antes solamente ofrecía frijoles y tortillas en su domicilio, estos han sido grandes logros para ella y su familia. Las otras integrantes son las señoras Ángela de 59 años dedicada a la compra-venta de chatarras en su domicilio y Lilliam de 45 años comerciante de ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
This solidarity group includes three members. One of them is the coordinator Maria, who is 51 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of five children, none of whom are dependents. She works for a living selling beans, tortillas, and other food from her home. She started this business 16 years ago with a severance pay given to her by her previous place of work.

She is requesting the loan to purchase soda, corn, rice, beans, cabbage, beets, carrots, bundles of firewood, etc. Through the loans given by the institution, she has been able to increase her income, make improvements to her house, and expand her business, since before she only offered beans and tortillas in her home. These have been great successes for her and her family.

The other members are Ángela, 59, who has a scrap metal business in her home, and Lilliam, 45, who sells cosmetics and clothing as a street vendor.

loans.use: To purchase soda, corn, rice, beans, cabbage, beets, carrots, bundles of firewood, etc.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en: Remelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 17,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and spices for her store. She has been in this line of work for one year and supplements her income by buying and selling recycled materials. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new one to continue to build her business. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF, and dreams of saving enough money to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 30 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6°  grado, debido a la falta de dinero abandono los estudios.  Su pareja de vida le ayuda en la agricultura y el cuido del hogar solo sus hijos viven con él.


Juan se dedica a la siembra de maíz y hortalizas desde que tenia 12 años, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, ademas trabaja en la albañilería trabajo que aprendió de un hermano su día comienza ala 4: 00 AM para llegar a su trabajo tiene que caminar 45 minutos trabaja 8 horas diarias luego regresa a su casa a descansar con su familia. 


El crédito será invertido en la compra de semilla mejorada,  abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, entre otros insumos. 

Él sueña con que sus hijos logren graduarse en una profesión ya que él no lo logró, construir una casa, pues donde vive ahora está en muy malas condiciones, además desea comprar unas 10 vacas lecheras y pagar el crédito para seguir trabajando con está institución.

Juan sueña en preparar sus hijos en una carrera universitaria, poder comprar un vehículo para transportar su producto. Poder cambiar el techo de sus casa pues ya no sirve.
texts.en:
Juan, 30, studied to the 6th grade, due to a lack of money he dropped out of studies. His life partner helps him in agriculture and the upkeep of the home, only his children live with him. 

Juan has been making his living sowing corn and beans since the age of 12, a trade that he learned from his parents. He also works as a building which he learned from a brother. His day starts at 4:00 am and to get to work he has to walk 45 minutes. He works eight hours a day and then returns home to relax with his family.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of enhanced seeds, fertilizers, weed killers, pesticides and other supplies.

Juan dreams that his children will succeed in graduating into a profession as he was unable to, build a home, as where he lives is in very poor conditions, as well as buy 10 dairy cows and repay the loan to continue working with this entity.

Juan dreams of preparing his children for a university career, to be able to buy a vehicle to transport his goods and to be able to change the roof of his home as it is no longer of any good.

loans.use: to buy enhanced seeds, fertilizers, weed killers, pesticides and other supplies.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
ISABEL. Madre soltera de 31 años con y 5 hijos, 3 varones y 2 mujeres. Ella tiene un pequeño bazar en su casa y además comercializa ropa para toda edad y género. Su negocio le ayuda al estudio de todos sus hijos. Hace 3 años ella inicio su negocio con la venta de helados – gaseosas – gelatina – y aguas en botellas. Nos comenta que con el pedido de la gente de su barrio. Se animó a comprar productos de consumo masivo (arroz – azúcar – aceites – pan) y ponerse una tienda de alimentos. Con el paso del tiempo. Puso el bazar que atiende hasta la actualidad. El mismo que apoya para cubrir los gastos de la familia en salud- educación y alimentación. Con su negocio ha podido conseguir su casa propia.
Los 11 integrantes del grupo “DIVINO NIÑO” tienen negocios diferentes y varios viven en Palma Real (frontera limítrofe con Colombia)
ISABEL. Se considera una mujer emprendedora y dinámica. Se siente contenta con su negocio porque sus clientes son del mismo barrio y de barrios cercanos.
En un futuro. Desea tener más mercadería y poder adecuar su local para atender a más clientes.
texts.en:
The eleven members of the Divino Niño credit group have different businesses and live in Palma Real (on the border with Colombia).

Isabel is a single mother with five children—three boys and two girls.  She is 31 years old.  She has a small variety shop in her house and also sells clothing for every age and gender.  Her business helps her to send her children to school.  Three years ago she began her business with the sale of ice cream treats, soda pop, Jell-o, and bottled water.  She tells us that, at the request of people in her neighborhood, she was encouraged to buy staple products (rice, sugar, oil, bread) and open a grocery store.  With the passing of time, she added the variety shop that she works to this day.  This helps her to cover the expenses of her family in terms of healthcare, education, and food.  Through her business, she has been able to get her own house.

Isabel is considered to be an enterprising and dynamic woman.  She is happy with her business because her customers are from her neighborhood and the nearby neighborhoods.

In the future, she wants to have more merchandise and be able to update her shop to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and items to sell in her shop in Ecuador

loans.name: Flor De Pino Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres mujeres exitosas en sus labores cotidianos, es coordinado por la señora Paula de 38 años de edad y casada, se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva y cosméticos de manera ambulante a los pobladores de su comunidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de ropa como es camisetas, blusas, blúmer, bóxer, tobilleras, calcetas, así mismo invertirá en vanidades, cremas corporales, body, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar el negocio y con él las ganancias. Los otras socias son las señoras Edda de 37 años comerciante de ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante en su comunidad y Sandra de 34 años propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio. Estas mujeres luchan cada día para poder ofrecerle los servicios necesarios a su familia.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is made up of three women who are successful in the daily work, it is coordinated by Paula who is 38 years old and married. Paula makes her living selling new clothes and cosmetics from house to house to the inhabitants in her community. The loan that she is seeking is to buy clothes such as t-shirts, blouses, panties, boxer shorts, stockings and socks, in addition, she will invest in beauty products and body creams. 

With the previous loans, Paula has managed to grow the business and in doing so, the profits. The other members are Edda, 37, who is a street vendor of clothes and cosmetics in her community, and Sandra who is 34 years old owns a grocery store in her home. These women fight every day to offer the services needs by her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Genese

texts.en:
Genese has been farming for 18 years with the help of her husband.

Joining GDMPC helped to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business. Genese was able to repay her previous loan used for buying fertilizer.  

To prepare for the next planting season, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina works hard to support her family. Crispina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Crispina has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Crispina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel Constanza

texts.es:
Reina de 23 años de edad,  estudió hasta 4° grado, esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura tiene dos hijos nadie mas vive con ellos. 


Reina se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, colabora con su pareja en  los cultivos de maíz y ajonjolí; para llegar a su trabajo tienen que caminar unos 35 minutos trabajan seis horas diarias luego hay que regresar a atender sus hijos. 


El crédito sera invertido para comprar semilla, abono y herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz. 

Reina sueña en  que sus hijos estudien una carrera universitaria, ademas poder construir su casa de ladrillo
texts.en:
Reina, 23, studied to 4th grade, she is in a couple and her partner makes his living in agriculture; they have two children and no-one else lives with them.

Reina spends her time performing the household chores and helps her partner with the corn and sesame crops. To get to work, they need to walk around 35 minutes and they work six hours every day, after that they need to get back to care for their children. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and weed killer for the corn crop. 

Reina dreams that her children can pursue university studies and that she can build her house with bricks.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and weed killer for the corn crop.

loans.name: Masseck

texts.fr:
Monsieur Masseck, âgé de 50 ans, s’active dans l’élevage depuis plus de 25 ans. Il est marié à deux femmes et est père de 7 enfants. Masseck sollicite ce crédit, afin d’acheter 150 poussins et leur aliments. Il a rarement une rupture de stock de poulets, il prévoit toujours des poussins à coté de ceux qui grandissent. Masseck est actif pendant toute la journée et s’occupe lui-même de sa volaille. Il gère la dépense quotidienne, et est aidé par son fils ainé dans les charges familiales.
Masseck veut construire un grand poulailler et élever jusqu’à 500 sujets, c’est là son projet qui le tient plus à cœur et il pense pouvoir le réaliser grâce à l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en: Mr Masseck, 50 years old, has been active in raising animals for 25 years. He is married to two women and is the father of seven children. Masseck is asking for a loan in order to purchase 150 baby chicks and their feed. He rarely runs out of chickens to sell, as he always purchases baby chicks alongside the growing chickens. Masseck is active every day and takes care of his poultry stock by himself. He takes care of daily expenses, and is helped by is eldest son in covering family expenses. Masseck would like to build a large henhouse in order to raise 500 chickens, a project that he is eager to implement thanks to the support of IMCEC.

loans.use: purchase 150 baby chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Tilita Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora María del Socorro de 69 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de especies, condimentos y propietaria de un molino en su domicilio, crédito lo solicita para la compra de diversidad de especies como es vinagre, pimienta, clavo de olor, manzanilla, achote, etc., los créditos anteriores le ha ayudado a la socia para su superación personal por lo que le ha permitido brindarle mejor calidad de vida a sus familia. Las otras socias son las señoras María Sebastiana de años dedicada a la venta de recargas claro y movistar, nacatamales, tortillas, hielo y helados en su comunidad, y Concepción de 45 años de edad, propietaria de una mini pulpería en su domicilio. Este grupo tiene 24 ciclos de estar trabajando con la institución y son un ejemplo de superación personal.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three members who are successful in their work lives. 

The coordinator is María del Socorro, who is 69 years old. Her business is the sale of spices and condiments, and she is the owner of a mill at her place of residence. She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of spices, such as vinegar, pepper, clove, chamomile, annatto, etc. The previous loans have helped the borrower's self-improvement, which has allowed her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

The other members are María Sebastiana, who adds funds to Claro and Movistar cellphones and sells nacatamales, tortillas, ice, and ice cream in her community, and Concepción, who is 45 years old and has a small grocery store that she runs out of her home. The group has worked with the loan institution for 24 cycles and are an example of self-improvement.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia has been managing their own farm of rice with her husband, and this is their main source of income. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm inputs and was able to sustain it. The farm is still going and is continuing to give them a better income. With her revenue, Lilia was also able to put up a piggery business. Preparing for the improvement, Lilia took a new loan to purchase additional piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is 54 years old, widowed and has seven children, three of whom are studying. To gain income and support her family, she raises hogs for future sale. She has been in her business for over nine years. She wanted to improve the growth of hogs, but she had insufficient funds to use in her business. So, she decided to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and medicine for hogs. She hopes to keep improving her small business, and further achieve economic stability for the family.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for hogs.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: She is from Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. In order to have her own source of income, last year she opened a small store in their village. She is asking for her first loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Her dream is to improve the general living of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Raquele

texts.en: Raquele has been growing and harvesting rice to sell in town and has had this business for more than 10 years, and this is the primary source of income for the family. With her generated income, she was able to improve their house. Raquele took a new loan recently to cover the costs for house renovation. She is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her family's lives.

loans.use: to cover the costs for house renovation

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 30 years old and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loads. Maricel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc. in her general store. Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 48 years old, and widowed with three children who are in school.
She earns a living with poultry in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her chickens.
Rosalina has been working with poultry for one year, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream; to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her chickens.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 48 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school, Florencia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like drinks, groceries, etc. Florencia has been in this business for 28 years.
 

In the future, Florencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like drinks and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, and she is now applying for a loan of $800.00 to improve her business.She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2004 with her own working capital of $70.00. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as noodles,cigarettes,coffee,sugar,salt, and fish. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past ten years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles,cigarettes,coffee,sugar,salt, and fish.

loans.name: Amanda Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es una señora divorciada, ella tiene  34 años  de edad, Viviana se dedica unos 8 años  a su negocio de sala de belleza, también lidera en un grupo de mujeres que venden productos por catálogo, Viviana tiene 4 hijos de 15, 10, 8 y  4 años de edad de los cuales los 3 mayores se encuentran estudiando y el menor de ellos tiene una discapacidad que no  puede hablar y que aprendió a caminar a los 3 años y Viviana lucha contra esta enfermedad ya que lo lleva constantemente a las terapias. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para venderlos y utilizarlos en su sala de belleza, esta señora luchadora comenta que está contenta  con su negocio ya que ella paga arriendo en una casa donde puede vivir y atender su negocio y esto le permite estar con su hijo ya que el niño requiere mucho cuidado y paciencia, su aspiración es seguir adelante con su negocio y por medio de este tener el dinero suficiente para pagar los gastos de mejoría de su hijo y que llegue a ser lo más normal posible.
texts.en: Viviana is 34 years old and divorced.  Viviana has had her beauty salon business for about eight years.  She also leads a group of women who sell items via catalog.  Viviana has four children, ages 15, 10, 8, and 4.  The three oldest attend school and the youngest has a handicap and can’t speak but learned to walk at age 3.  Viviana struggles against this illness and takes him to therapy repeatedly.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products to resell and to use in her salon.  This hardworking woman says that her business helps pay for rent on her house and it allows her to be near her son who needs lots of care and patience.  Her aspiration is to get ahead in her business and through this means, have enough money to pay for her son’s improved health so that he will be as normal as possible.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Ana Judith

texts.es: Ana está casada y tiene  hijos de 12, 8 y 5  años de edad que se encuentran estudiando, son 8  años que se dedica a su negocio de confeccionar ropa, ella vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo para vivir y para atender su negocio ahí mismo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para confeccionar la ropa que le solicitan sus clientes, su aspiración es que mejore su negocio y cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos y comprar una pequeña casa para su familia.
texts.en: Ana is married and has three children, ages 12, 8 and 5 who attend school.  She has been making clothing for eight years.  She lives in a rented home and has her business there as well.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric to make the clothing that her customers have asked for.  Her aspiration is to improve her business, cover her children’s education expenses and buy a small house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: refurbish his photo studio and set up a game room

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase hair extensions, cosmetic products and cooking pots

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas, coordinado por la señora Yaritza de 27 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 9 años, se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva y de segunda de manera ambulante de lunes a domingo, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de ropa nueva y pacas de calidad de cómo es camisas, shorts, pantalones y vestidos. Otra de las socias es la señora Pabla de 43 años dedicada a venta de productos varios de forma ambulante a los pobladores de su comunidad y la señora Susana de 59 años quien ofrece el servicio de comida en su domicilio desde hace 6 años atrás. Estas socias solicitan el crédito con el fin de aumentar las ventas y por ende las ganancias, pues con los créditos anteriores han logrado mejoras en los negocios.
texts.en:
This group has three successful members and is coordinated by 27-year-old Yaritza. She is married and a mother to one nine-year-old son. Yaritza makes a living selling new and second-hand clothing as a a street vendor. She works seven days per week. Yaritza needs this loan in order to buy packs of new and good quality clothes. She will buy shirts, shorts, trousers and dresses.

Another member of the group is 43-year-old Pabla. She makes a living as a street vendor selling various products to people in the community. Susana, 59 years old, has been selling meals from her home for six years.

The members are applying for this loan in order to increase sales and profits. Previous loans have helped them to make improvements to their business.

loans.use: to buy packs of new and good quality clothes.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has been using her previous loan for farm fertilization for improvement. This previous loan was not enough to fertilize the whole farm. In order to have a greener farm, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She hopes to progress in her business so she can cover her family's needs.

Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lilyn

texts.en: As a married parent of one child, Lilyn works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lilyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of dried fish to sell at her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Lilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado por falta de recursos económicos, esta casada su esposo trabaja como promotor de materia,  tiene 4 hijos pero ya todos están casados y solo vive ella con su esposo. 

Tomasa se dedica los oficios domésticos, es a lo que se a dedicado toda su vida al cuidado de sus hijos,  piensa a futuro poner una venta de frescos y panes para no pasar tan triste y poder tener un ingreso propio.

El crédito sera invertido en la compra de una licuadora,  un juego de comedor y otra parte para compra de lamina para una habitación.

Tomasa sueña en poder instalar un negocio como una tienda y  a futuro poder comprar un terreno y poder construir una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 54 years old and studied up to the ninth grade due to lack of economic resources. She is married, and her husband works as a promoter. She has four children, but all of them are already married, and she lives only with her spouse.

Tomasa works in the home -- she has dedicated her whole life to raising her children. In the future, she plans to start a shop that sells soda and bread so that she is not so melancholy and can have her own income.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of a blender, a dining room furniture set, and laminate for a bedroom. 

Tomasa dreams of being able to start a business such as a store, and being able to buy land to construct a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a blender, a dining room set, and laminate for a bedroom

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Josefina to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like beer, soy sauce and fish. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy beer, soy sauce and fish

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun, 56, is married to a humble man and they have seven grown-up children. Soeun and her husband help each other manage their farm for rice and cassava production. They have been doing this business for nearly 40 years, and earn enough to cover their family’s expenses.

Today Soeun is asking for a loan in order to prepare soil for the new growing season and to buy required farm supplies for her cassava crops. She hopes that she will be supported in order to be able to grow her business and improve the income earned for her family. She is very thankful in advance to all lenders.

loans.use: to prepare soil for the new growing season and to buy required farm supplies for her cassava crops.

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es: Yanira tiene 21 años  de edad y habita en casa propia  junto a su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Yanira se dedica a la venta de tostadas de plátanos, yuca y papas de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Yanira desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra. Yanira solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lamina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la vivienda.
texts.en: Yanira is 21 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner and three year old daughter.  Yanira sells banana, yucca, and potato tostadas on foot as has done so for a long time.  She and her partner support the household. Yanira wants to repair the roof on her house, which is deteriorated and leaks.  Yanira is asking for this loan, through FUSAI, to buy galvanized metal and lumber to repair the roof.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Gs Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
La señora Eva se dedica al comercio y es una persona emprendedora de su comunidad su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, venta de ropa americana de segunda mano, esto lo realiza de manera ambulante visitando las comunidades cercana a su casa de habitación, ella cuenta con los clientes de diferentes empresas de la zona, los cuales le compra su mercadería por la calidad y los buenos precios, ella solicita el apoyo nuevamente del préstamo ya que con el anterior ella mando a realizar la instalaciones de luz y eso le ha cambiado mucho la calidad de vida, ahora ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de un fardo de ropa americana clasificada.
Eva sueña con tener una pieza en sus casa para poner su ropa en ganchos y exhibirla para sus clientes, ella solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas, Ana se dedica a la venta de verduras y sandalias de hule de mujer esto lo realiza de manera ambulante, desde hace 22 años y la señora Sobeida se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general en su casa de habitación esto lo realiza hace 1 año todas ellas no cuentan con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y surtir  sus negocios.  
Danlí, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Eva is a merchant and an enterprising person in her community. Her principal source of income is derived from her business, selling 2nd hand American clothes. She does this in the streets, visiting communities near her residence. Eva can count on customers who work in different enterprises in the region, and who buy her merchandise for its quality and good prices.

Eva is requesting a loan anew. The previous loan was used to install lighting and this has greatly changed the quality of her life. Now, she is soliciting a loan to purchase a diversified bundle of American clothing to sell.

Eva dreams of having a wardrobe in her house in which she could hang clothing and exhibit it for her customers. She is requesting the loan in a group manner with the 2 companions: Ana has sold vegetables and women's rubber sandals in the streets for some 22 years, while Sobeida has sold general groceries from her residence for the last year. They all lack sufficient capital to satisfy customer demand and re-supply their businesses.

Danlí, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing to sell in the streets.

loans.name: El Cerro Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cinco socios exitosos en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora Brenda de 30 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solamente uno depende económicamente de ella de 4 años de edad se dedica a la venta de comida en su comunidad de manera ambulante, este negocio lo impulsó hace 2 años y requiere el crédito para aumentar el inventario como es en arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, aceite, flete de leña, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora María de 49 años propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, y  el señor José de 41 años quien es propietario de una ebanistería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is made up of five members who are successful in their work lives. It is coordinated by Brenda, who is 30 years old, in a relationship, and mother to four children, only one of whom is financially dependent on her and is 4 years old.

She makes her living selling food in her community as a street vendor. She started this business 2 years ago, and needs the loan to increase her inventory of rice, beans, oil, sugar, loads of firewood, etc.

The other members are María, 49 years old and owner of a convenience store out of her home, and José, 41 years old and owner of a cabinetmaker's shop.

loans.use: to buy staples such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, loads of firewood, etc.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is 58 years old, married and has three grown up children. She operates a store with her husband who helps her in selling grocery items to her neighborhood. She uses her income as revolving capital and for bills at home and daily meals. She is now asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy noodles, eggs, bread, biscuits, canned goods and soap for resale. It will help increase her sales capacity and help her earn more profits. With enough profit, she hopes to improve her store and build a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, bread, biscuits, canned goods and soap for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 42, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Gerry, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from those round, palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers create every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business.

Evelyn hopes to expand her business and dreams for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 49 years of age, married to a government employee, and blessed with three children. She owns and manages an internet cafe in their village. In this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 1,000 daily. Due to insufficient funds in their business, she would like to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 45,000 to purchase four brand new computers for her internet cafe. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase four brand new computers for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Jacinto Lugardo

texts.es:
El señor Jacinto un hombre luchador de 48 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 2 hijos el mayor tiene 17 años y el último tiene 1 año, vive y trabaja en el Recinto San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos, este Recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros a disfrutar de sus maravillosas hosterías y sitios de descanso que podemos encontrar.
Él se dedica a la agricultura trabaja en una finca ganadera solicita este crédito para emprender en un negocio de pollo, ya que conoce mucho del mismo y cuenta con el espacio y los implementos para realizar unos galpones, en este negocio le ayudara la esposa ya que ella lo está apoyando y saben que es un negocio muy rentable. 
Ellos vienen de una familia de bajos recursos económicos lo que les impidió estudiar, solo tienen la primaria, con esta inversión esperan mejorar su calidad de vida y apoyar a sus hijos para que se preparen y tengan un futuro mejor que el que ellos tienen. 
El señor Jacinto agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando a él y su familia
texts.en:
Jacinto is a hardworking 48 year old man in a solid common law marriage.  He has two children, ages 17 and 1.  He lives and works in the San Bernabe precinct, in the northwest part of the Pichincha province in the San Miguel de los Bancos settlement.  This precinct is well visited by local and international tourists to enjoy the marvelous hostels and rest areas found here.

He is into agriculture and works on a livestock farm.  He is asking for this loan to start a chicken business since he knows a lot about this business and has the space and equipment to make some chicken coops.  His wife will help him in this business because she is encouraging him and they know that this is a very profitable business.

They come from families with limited financial resources which kept them from finishing school.  They only have an elementary school education.  This loan will help them improve their quality of life and support their children so they can prepare themselves and have a better future than the one they have.

Jacinto is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and opportunity they are giving to their family.

loans.use: to start a chicken business.

loans.name: Cecile Mae

texts.en:
Cecile Mae works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Cecile Mae requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell at her store, such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

Cecile Mae has been in this business for two years, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Cecile Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store, such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her food vending business.

Maribel has been in this business for five years. Maribel earns more income from the general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Hydee

texts.en:
Hydee is 37 years old, and married with two children who are in school. Hydee works very hard to provide for them.

Hydee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Hydee has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan for 27,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell at her store.

Juliet has been in this business for 14 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, such as shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a mother of four who lives in Nairobi's Mukuru Settlements. She grew up in Machakos and later moved to Nairobi, where she got married and settled. She and her husband decided to start a small business to help them provide for their family. They decided to start a Fresh Life Franchise to be able to provide a better sanitation option for their community and to earn additional income. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets. The money earned from the facility will be used to repay her loan as well as provide a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Zubida 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Zubida 2. It consists of four women who are all hard working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 220,000 YER. 

Zubida is 47 years old and a divorced woman with four children. Her oldest child is 24 years old and the youngest one is 18 years old. She is an uneducated woman. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. After getting a divorce from her husband, Zubida decided to start her own business in order to cover all the expenses of the house. In the beginning, she had a small amount of money, which she had saved up herself.  Zubida invested that money in her own business. She has run her business for seven years, selling makeup, accessories, and perfume in order to cover all the expenses of the family. She sees this business as a profitable for her. To expand her business further, Zubida requested a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, cosmetics, and perfume to sell to the women in her area.

Zubida expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business by opening a store for selling incense and perfume.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, cosmetics, and perfume to sell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy noodles, oils, soap, coffee, sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: La señora Magali es madre de dos hijos de 26 y 17 años. Ella vive con su esposo  y sus dos hijos, Magali tiene su negocio propio, una bodega de abarrotes donde ofrece, verduras, pollo, carne, fruta, que le ha costado mucho sudor y sacrificio sacar adelante al lado de su esposo. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos. Ella atiende en promedio a 15 personas todos los días. La Sra. Magali piensa invertir el dinero de su crédito que le otorgo EDAPROSPO en comprar nueva mercadería como gaseosas y cervezas y así surtir mejor su negocio. Su sueño es tener un Mini Market en el que pueda ofrecer una gran diversidad de productos. La señora  tiene ya en el grupo 7 años donde “Existe una buena relación entre todas las socias”, nos cuenta. Ella se siente muy agradecida de los inversionistas KIVA y les quiere hacer llegar la petición de que sigan apoyando al grupo y a muchos otros más.
texts.en:
Magali is the mother of two children, 26 and 17 years old. She lives with her husband and two children.

She has her own business, a small grocery store where she sells vegetables, chicken, meat, and fruit. It has taken a lot of sweat and sacrifice to get ahead alongside her husband. Her main customers are her neighbors, and she attends to an average of 15 people everyday.

Magali plans to invest the loan money that EDAPROSPO is giving her to buy new merchandise such as soft drinks and beer, in order to better stock her business.

The lady has been in the group for 7 years, where "there is a good relationship between all the members," she tells us. She is very grateful to Kiva investors, and would like to ask them to continue supporting the group and many others.

loans.use: to run her business by buying beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man is 50 years old, and a simple woman. She lives in Prey Chhor, with her husband and four children. To make a living, Man grows crops, particularly rice and cassava, both for the family’s sustenance and for sale. She is very happy, because her husband is very supportive and helps her manage their farm. From the last experience of growing crops, Man generated a good income for her family. She has been doing farming for more than 30 years now.

In order to boost her productivity, Man is asking for a loan in the sum of US $400, which she will use to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and other required materials for the new growing season. This will help develop her farming output and help her to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and other required materials for the new growing season.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
This is Jenefer, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jerry, a construction worker, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Jenefer is a mineral water distributor. What she does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers, and sell them by the 5-gallon container, with a profit. Her regular customers on her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more gallons of mineral water, to expand her product inventory.

Jenefer hopes that her business will continue to grow. She dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more containers of mineral water.

loans.name: Bernadine

texts.en:
Bernadine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Bernadine has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

Bernadine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 38 years old. She is married with six children. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for resale. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy more clothes for sale. She also plans to use the profits for paying school fees for the children. Regina is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jessica is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of dry goods to sell, like slippers, pants, and blouses.

Lelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell, like slippers, pants, and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda, 49 years of age, is married to a farmer and has been blessed with three children. She's been in the hog-raising business for almost one year, and she earns a net income of PHP 10,000 per hog. She usually spends her income from her business on the school fees of her children.

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to obtain a loan, in the amount of PHP 16,000. She will use it to purchase hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.en: Telesforo Sr. is 59 years old, married, and has two children. He is a farmer and a hog raiser while his spouse is a housewife. In his hog raising business, he only generates PHP2,000 each time he sells his hogs. Telesforo wants to keep improving his business; that is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and medicine for hogs. He hopes it will help achieve good growth and nutrition of the hogs, and enable him to sell them at a higher cost someday. He will save additional revenue for his family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and medicine for hogs.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 48 years old and married. She has five children. Lilibeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been doing this work for years, now.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed from NWTF before, to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Exiquila

texts.en: Exiquila works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase gasoline, a fishing net, bamboo, etc. Exiquila has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, a fishing net, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en: Domitille is 39 years old. She sells gowns for brides and suits for men. She wants the loan to buy more gowns and suits to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings. She is very happy with the previous loan.

loans.use: To buy gowns for brides and suits for men, to sell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 32-year-old, single woman. She has two children, and they go to school. She has been in the greengrocery business for two years.
