She works seven days a week and twelve hours a day. Her business is located in the rural area, and she also engages in farming, for additional income. Everlyne hopes to educate her children; however, a lack of enough capital is her challenge. She needs a loan to buy tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and cabagges to sell.

loans.name: Yeab

texts.en:
Yeab is aged 54 years and married; she has three children. She lives with her family, in a wooden house in a rural village of the Koh Krolor district. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice. Having been in this business for 10 years, she manages to earn about 46,000 KHR per day.

Yeab has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, and she completely paid back the previous loan. Now she is applying for a new loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and earn more income, which would improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: José Libardo

texts.es:
El señor José es un diligente hombre de campo que por razones personales tuvo que desplazarse hacia la ciudad para buscar fortuna.
Desde hace más de 15 años se gana la vida vendiendo frutas, verduras y legumbres en un carro que transporta por diferentes sitios de la ciudad.
Trabaja todos los días de 6:00 Am a 4:00 Pm y de manera ambulante.
Actualmente solicita un respaldo económico para darle un impulso a su negocio y salir de la recesión que está enfrentando.
Este dinero será invertido en la compra de inventario de legumbres y frutas aumentando así su oferta de alimentos y teniendo un nivel de ventas más elevado.
El sueña con tener una vivienda propia para albergar allí a su esposa y a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is a diligent man of the fields who, for personal reasons, had to move to the city to seek his fortune.

For more than 15 years he has been earning a living selling fruits, vegetables and greens in a car that he takes around to different parts of the city.

He works mobile every day from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm and is asking for financial support to boost his business and come out of the recession he is facing.

He will use the money to buy greens and fruits to increase his inventory and have greater sales. 

He dreams of having his own home to shelter his wife and three children.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en:
Mann is 53 years old and living with her husband and one child in a rural village located in the Kiri Vong district. Rice farming has been the main income source for her family for about 23 years. It earns them a daily income of about 50,000KHR. 

This will be Mann's fourth loan with VisionFund. She will use it to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita has been making woven nipa panels, which are used as roofing material. For many years, she has been able to sustain their daily living with her little income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for buying raw materials.

To fulfill orders from her customers, she took a new loan to buy the materials needed to make more nipa panels. She will also buy products woven by other people. She will sell the products in bulk, in town. She hopes to improve and expand her business with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to make more nipa panels

loans.name: Luciana Guadalupe

texts.es: Luciana tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 3 años de edad y su hija de 9 años de edad. Luciana tiene un pequeño negocio de tortillas, todos los días se dedica a la preparación de los ingredientes necesarios para poder hacer las ricas tortillas que tanto demandan sus clientes. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de dos paredes de adobe y para el pago de la mano de obra necesaria.
texts.en: Luciana is 36 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and two sons, ages 13 and 3, and a 9 year old daughter.  Luciana has a small tortilla business and prepares the necessary ingredients daily so she can make her delicious tortillas that her customers demand so much.  She decided to ask for this loan through FUSAI so she can improve her family’s quality of life by building two adobe walls and pay for the necessary labor.

loans.use: to build two walls.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza -Pasñapacana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA ESPERANZA -PASÑAPACANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina ella es conviviente y tiene 52 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende platanos,mandarinas,papayas y naranjas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva estas frutas, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de café, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank, “Nueva Esperanza-Pasñapacana”. This bank is located in the Echarate District, which belongs to the province of La Convención and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Josefina. She lives with her partner and she is 52 years old. She works in her fruit sales business, selling plantains, mandarins, papayas, and oranges. She has a plot of land where she grows these fruits, and she has a market stand where she sells them.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years now, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she could sell the fruit.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase seed and fertilizer for her field.

The other members have a coffee sales business, a fruit sales business, a grocery store, and a food sales business. 

The member thanks those who are part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments within the period prescribed.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer for her field.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 52, is a married woman with four children. One of her children is still in school. Lydia is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is in the pig-fattening business in the Philippines, and she has been in this line of work for three years.

Lydia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies, for her business. In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Dios Bendice Pacaya Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran seis socias laboriosas, so coordinado por la señora Candelaria de 31 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 12, 9 y 4 años respectivamente, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Huembes de la capital, se ha dedica a este negocio desde hace 20 años  y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosechas de mango, la socia cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para la compra y venta de comercialización de los productos. Otra socia es la señora Nubia de 39 años, quien comercializa calzados de manera ambulante en la ciudad de león, la señora Blanca de 33 años comerciante de ropa de segunda y cosméticos en las ciudades de Jinotepe y Diriamba, la señora Yarixa de 25 años dedicada a la crianza de pollos en su domicilio y la señora Esther de 44 años comerciante de bananos en el mercado de Masaya, y la señora María Elena propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio. Cada una de las socias presenta diversas maneras de laborar para poder obtener el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 6 hard-working women, coordinated by Señora Candelaria, who is 31 years old. She is married and has three children who are 12, 9 and 4 respectively. She works selling fruit and vegetables in the Huembes Market in the capital. She has been doing this for more than 20 years and she is asking for this loan in order to buy mango crops. The member relies on the help of her husband for buying, selling, and putting the produce on the market.

The other members include Señora Nubia, who is 39 years old and sells footwear on a street stall in the city of Léon. Señora Blanca who is 33 years old, sells second hand clothes and cosmetics in the cities of Jinotepe and Diriamba. Señora Yarixa is 25 years old and raises chickens at her home. Señora Esther is 44 years old and sells bananas at the Masaya Market. Señora María Elena runs a grocery store out of her home. Each one of the current members presents a variety of work in order to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy mango crops.

loans.name: Gs Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
La Sra. María se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva,  cuenta con 15 años de experiencia, negocio que le ha ayuda  a salir adelante, junto con sus hijas,  ya que los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio, contribuyen al bienestar familiar, su negocio lo atiende de manera domiciliar y ambulante, sus principales clientes personas que viven en su misma comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de, camisas, zapatos, sandalias, carteras y cremas para mujer, ella sueña con tener más surtido su negocio de venta de ropa nueva  y contar con más clientes,  está solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas; Ana se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal, venta de ropa usada,  ella cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, Maira se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal, venta de carne de cerdo, ella cuenta con 15 años de experiencia.
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras Abril 2014
texts.en:
Señora María is a businesswoman and sells new clothes as her main professional activity. She has 15 years experience with the business which has allowed her to get ahead, along with her daughters, since the income she receives from her business contributes to the well being of her family. Her business is run from her home but is also mobile. Her main customers are people who live in the same community. She is asking for this loan in order to buy shirts, shoes, sandals, wallets and creams for women. She dreams of having more stock for her clothing business and having more customers.

She is asking for the loan as a group with the following people: Ana, who sells second hand clothing as her main activity and has 4 years experience, and Maira, who sells pork and has 15 years experience.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras Abril 2014

loans.use: to buy stock for her clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: cover the boarding fees for her canoe so she can go out to see to catch fish

loans.name: Hugo Ariel

texts.es: Hugo tiene 32 años de edad y habita  junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia. Hugo se gana la vida mediante la venta de productos de primera necesidad ya que desde hace 4 años cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia además, cuenta con un molino de nixtamal lo cual le permite percibir ingresos y junto con su compañera de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Actualmente, Hugo y su compañera de vida no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
Hugo is 32 years old and lives with his life partner in their own home. Hugo earns a living by selling basic necessities. He has had a small shop for 4 years now in his home. He also has a corn grinder which allows him to earn some money, and together with his life partner they manage to pay the bills. 

Currently, Hugo and his life partner do not have electricity, which is why he has made the decision to ask for this loan from FUSAI which he will invest in installing the service they need.

loans.use: to install electricity in their home.

loans.name: Gs Yire Group

texts.es:
La joven Wendy se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva,  cuenta con 1 año de experiencia, negocio que le ha ayuda  a salir adelante, junto con sus dos hijos,  ya que los ingresos que obtiene de su negocio, contribuyen al bienestar  de su familia, su negocio lo atiende de manera domiciliar y ambulante, sus principales clientes personas que viven en su barrio, y los demás barrios del municipio de Oropoli.
Wendy está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de de, bikini, bóxer, lociones, tintes, brazier, faldas para mujer, camisas y bóxer para hombre, ella sueña con tener más surtido su negocio de venta de ropa nueva  y contar con más clientes,  ella está solicitando el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas;
Rita se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal la venta de ropa, ella cuenta con 1 año de experiencia.
Mariela se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal la venta de abarrotería, ella cuenta con 1 año de experiencia.
Keyla se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal la venta de ropa nueva y zapatos, ella cuenta con 6 años de experiencia.
Marian se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal venta de medicinas, ella cuenta con 2 años de experiencia .
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras Abril 2014
texts.en:
Wendy is a businesswoman and her main activity is selling new clothes. She has one year of experience. The business has helped her to get ahead along with her two children, since the income she earns from her business contributes to the wellbeing of her family. Her business is run from her home but is also mobile. Her main customers are people who live in her neighbourhood, and the other neighbourhoods of Oropoli.

Wendy is asking for this loan in order to buy bikinis, panties, lotions, dyes, bras and skirts for women, and shirts and boxers for men. She dreams of having more stock for her business and having more customers. She is asking for a group loan with the following people:

Rita sells clothing and has one year of experience.
Mariela has a grocery store and has one year of experience.
Keyla sells new clothes and shoes and has 6 years of experience.
Marian sells medicines and has 2 years of experience.
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras April 2014

loans.use: to buy stock for her clothing business.

loans.name: Wangnignigbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement WANGNIGNIGBE 1 est composé de dix personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Nathalie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Âgée de 34 ans, Nathalie est mariée à un certain Firmin et est mère de quatre enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble à leurs différents besoins. Afin de faire face à ses charges, Nathalie vend depuis une dizaine d’année, des produits vivriers, des condiments, etc. à son domicile. Nathalie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Nathalie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement WANGNIGNIGBE 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The WANGNIGNIGBE 1 group is composed of ten people living in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, Nathalie, can be seen in the photo with her hand raised. Nathalie is 34 years old, married to Firmin, and the mother of four children, several of whom attend school. The couple live together with their children and together, they take care of the family's needs. In order to address these needs, Nathalie has been selling diverse food products and condiments for the past ten years from her home. She stocks up at the market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales, Nathalie is asking, alongside the other members of the WANGNIGNIGBE 1 group, her first loan from ALIDE.

loans.use: purchase food supplies, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Argelia

texts.es: Argelia tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos. Argelia es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de leche, queso y crema desde mucho tiempo. Argelia hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de habitacionales hace unos meses comenzó a construir su vivienda con materiales mas resistentes pero el presupuesto no le alcanza a cubrir todos los gastos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, polines, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Argelia is 56 years old, and she lives in her own house with her children. Argelia is an enterprising and very hard working woman who has been processing and selling milk, cheese, and cream for a long time.

Argelia does everything in her power to provide better living conditions for her family, and with the desire to improve their housing conditions, she started to build their house with stronger materials some months ago. However, her budget cannot cover all of the costs, so she is seeking a loan with FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of materials such as brick, cement, sand, purlins, etc.  

She hopes to have this financing and thus provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, purlins, etc. in order to finish building her home.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, opta por solicitar más capital que invertirá en la compra de herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono, semilla e insecticidas, se limitara a comprar los insumos agrícolas básicos para seguir cultivando maíz y frijol.
Con el crédito anterior fortaleció el negocio de cultivo de granos básicos, su cosecha fue muy abundante le facilito abastecer a su familia, vender más de lo que vendía antes y tiene mayor rentabilidad.
texts.en: Manuel has decided to request more capital to invest in buying herbicides, pesticides, fertilizer, seeds and insecticide. He is limiting himself to the purchase of basic agricultural inputs to grow corn and beans. With his last loan he strengthened his business of growing basic grains, his harvest was abundant which helped provide for his family. He sold more then he had sold before and made more profit.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora Maria es una guerrera de la vida una mujer muy activa. Tiene 61 años y tiene la energía de una adolecente a la hora de trabajar con sus cultivos.
Ella actualmente posee un terreno de tierra en el cual tiene una siembra de tomate de aliño que ella misma cosecha y vende en el municipio de Rionegro, Colombia.
Con esta actividad ha logrado obtener los ingresos necesarios para vivir y sostener a sus 6 hijos.
Ella se levanta todos los días desde muy temprano con todas las ganas de progresar y salir adelante.
Ella solicita un aliento económico para realizar un mejoramiento a su invernadero comprando madera para las bases del techo y una lona especial para estos cultivos.
Sueña con tener unas grandes hectáreas de tierra donde pueda sembrar diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a life warrior and a very active woman. At 61 years old, she has the energy of a teenager when it comes to taking care of her crops. She currently has a piece of land on which she grows tomatoes which she picks herself and sells in the municipality of Rionegro, Colombia. This work has allowed her to earn enough income to support herself and her six children. 

She gets up very early every day full of enthusiasm to progress and get ahead. She is asking for this loan so she can make some repairs to her hothouse. She will buy wood to support the roof and a special tarpaulin. She dreams of having a large amount of acreage so she can grown different crops.

loans.use: to buy materials to make improvements to her hothouse, such as wood and a tarpaulin.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 42 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melchora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Melchora has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, cereals, etc. 

Melchora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 41 years old. She has five children between 8 and 22 years old. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to pay school fees for the children. She is very successful with her charcoal business and she believes that the previous loan helped much in upgrading her business, because now she acts as the charcoal distributor in the town.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, opta por un nuevo préstamo, porque ve en los financiamientos una herramienta para fortalecer el negocio rápidamente, comprara maíz, cal, bolsas, leña, gas propano, faldas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos y cosméticos, tendrá todo lo necesario para elaborar la venta de tortillas y fortalecerá la venta de cosméticos y ropa.
Las circunstancias familiares han cambiado positivamente, sea mantenido trabajando por un largo tiempo sin la escases de productos, tiene más clientes satisfechos, todo esto ha sido con la ayuda del crédito anterior. María ha incorporado otros rubros con los cueles tiene un poco más de ingresos.
texts.en: María has decided to request a new loan as she sees the loans as tools to strengthen her business quickly. She will buy corn, lime, bags, wood, propane, skirts, shirts, pants, dresses and cosmetics. She will have the basics to made tortillas for sale and strengthen her sales of cosmetics and clothing. Her family's circumstances have changed for the better as she has continued to work for a long time without lacking product. She has more satisfied clients and all of this because of the last loan. María has added a few more items so she can make a little more income.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, bags, wood, propane, skirts, shirts, pants, dresses and cosmetics.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas y lo coordina la señora Argentina de 28 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos, ofrece el servicio de comida (fritanga) en su domicilio, la socia solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, carne de res, carne de cerdo, maíz, plátano verde, plátano maduro, queso, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores ha logrado mejoras en su vivienda y la compra de un juego de sillas, por lo que afirma que le han ayudado para su superación personal, familiar y de negocio. Las otras socias son las señoras Rosa de 38 años dedicada a la venta de pescado en el mercado de la municipalidad y Fátima de 24 años de edad ofrece el servicio de venta de refresco y gaseosa en su domicilio.
texts.en: The solidarity group is comprised of three successful members, and Argentina, 28, is the coordinator.  She is a common-law wife with three children, and provides a fried food service in her home.  She is requesting this loan to purchase basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, beef, pork, corn, green bananas, ripe bananas, cheese, and other items.  With the previous loans, she managed to improve her home, and purchase a set of chairs, which she says has contributed to her self-improvement as well as that of her family and business. The other members are Rosa, 38, who is engaged in selling fish at the town market, and Fátima, 24, who sells soft drinks and sodas in her home.

loans.use: to purchase beans, oil, beef, pork, corn, green bananas, ripe bananas, cheese, and other items.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 57-year-old married woman who has five children. Her youngest child lives with them, while the rest live separately. She raises hogs, while her spouse is a farmer. Together, they earn an income for the family’s sustenance. 

Fe is now asking for additional capital of 6,000 PHP to invest in her hog-raising business. She will buy feed, medicines and vaccines. From this, the hogs will grow healthier and she can sell them at a higher price. She will save the additional revenue for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, disfruta de la armonía que tiene en su hogar, vive junto a su esposo y una hija, su esposo trabaja como motorista de un micro bus, desde muy pequeña le gusta la cocina, cuando ella formo su propia familia debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos instalo una venta antojitos tales como atoles, empanadas, tostadas, enredos, etc.,
Con el préstamo que requiere comprara plátanos, maíz, aceite, gas propano, azúcar, entre otros materiales básicos para elaborar la venta, el resto será utilizado para realizar remodelaciones al local del negocio, dará una mejor imagen ante sus clientes.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio, remodelar su vivienda y seguir apoyando en los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes enjoys the harmony in her household.  She lives with her husband and a daughter.  Her husband works as a micro bus driver.

Ever since she was very little she has liked cooking.  When she formed her own family, she started selling snacks such as corn-based beverages, empanadas, tostadas, and fried yucca threads, etc.  She did this out of the need to improve her family's income.

She needs to use the loan to buy bananas, corn, cooking oil, propane gas, and sugar, among other basic materials to use to make food to sell.  The rest will be used to remodel her place of business.  It will give her customers a better image of her business.

Her dream is to expand her business, to remodel her house, and to continue helping her family with the expenses.

loans.use: to buy bananas, corn, cooking oil, propane gas, and sugar and to remodel her place of business.

loans.name: Bernabe De Jesus

texts.es:
Bernabé, invirtió el crédito anterior en insumos agrícolas que le ayudaron a preparar el terreno para cultivar maíz y frijol, la cosecha fue muy abundante, su situación económica ha mejorado y la familia tiene un estilo de vida más confortable.
En esta oportunidad se decidió por un nuevo préstamo que utilizara para comprar insecticidas, abono, herbicidas, semilla y plaguicidas, así continuara trabajando en la agricultura sin problemas.
texts.en:
Bernabé used the previous loan on agricultural supplies that helped him prepare the land to cultivate corn and beans.  The harvest was very abundant.  His financial situation has improved, and his family has a more comfortable lifestyle.

This time he decided on a new loan that he will use to buy insecticides, fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, and pesticides.  This way he will continue working in agriculture without any problems.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, herbicides, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Al- Tef 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Tef 2. It consists of four women who are all hard working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 140,000 YER. 

Mona is a 29-year-old divorced woman with three children. Her oldest child is nine years old and the youngest one is four years old. She studied in elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. She is a very active and dynamic woman. She has a strong determination to look after her children. After getting a divorce from her husband, she decided to start her own business in order to cover her children with the necessary needs. In the beginning, she started with a small amount of money that she had saved herself.  Mona invested that money in her own business. She worked in that business for two years selling ready-made women's clothes. She sees this business as a profitable one for her. Unfortunately, most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her children. On other hand, she wants to improve her business. For this reason, Mona is requesting a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ready-made women's clothes and resell them to the women in her area.

Mona looks forward to expanding her business by opening a large store to sell the ready-made clothes. She hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Soknol

texts.en:
Soknol, aged 30, lives in a rural village in the Preshnet Presh district and has two children. She and her husband farm rice in the area to make a living. She has been in this business for six years. The current business earns her about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is the microloan for Soknol with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for plowing the field. She hopes this loan will help her in timely growing rice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for plowing the field

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Miranda

texts.en: Miranda is applying for a loan of 800 USD from Tuba Rai Metin. She is 38 years old and married. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as Sagiko, bread, Sprite, milk, noodles, fish, coffee, sugar, salt and cigarettes. She makes good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Miranda lives in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Edna. She is married with four children. For many years, Edna has been operating a farm with her husband. She began her business to enhance the family's regular income for their livelihood. Her farm is located in the village 

Edna would like a loan to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. She hopes that this loan will help improve her status, both at home and in her business. 

In the future, Edna plans to expand the farm to ensure more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 49 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 20 years. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and married, with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Erlinda has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell. She has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, manifiesta que con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior su porqueriza le dejo más ganancias por la venta de cerdos en optimas condiciones y la cosecha de sus cultivos han sido de una mayor calidad, sus nuevos ingresos le permiten cancelar su deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de concentrado para cerdos, abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas, contara con el alimento necesario para alimentar a los cerdos por una larga temporada y cultivara maíz, frijol sin problemas.
texts.en: Francisco states that with the help of his previous loan, his swineherd produced more income from the sale of pigs in optimal condition and the harvest of his crops has been of better quality. His new income permits him to pay off his debt and improve his family's quality of life. The loan that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of pig feed, fertilizer, herbicides, fungicides, and insecticides, and he will have the food necessary to feed his pigs for a long period of time and he will grow corn and beans without problems.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, fertilizer, herbicides, fungicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ann Mae

texts.en:
Ann Mae is 46 years old and married, with two children who are both in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ann Mae has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twenty years.

Ann Mae has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring shop. In the future, Ann Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Preshnet Presh district of Banteay Meanchey province, Roun is 61 years. She is a rice farmer who grows rice in her village. She has been in this business for 30 years, earning about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Roun has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The past loans have helped her improve her livelihood. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to raise more crops on her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas y lo coordina la señora Flor de 25 años de edad y acompañada, se dedica  a la venta de derivados del maíz como es la chicha pinolillo y pinol en el mercado de la municipalidad y sectores aledaños a su comunidad, se ha dedicado en este negocio desde hace 3 años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de maíz, frambuesas y flete de leña, clavo de olor, canela, etc., la socia por medio de los créditos ha logrado aumentar el negocio, ayudándole a su superación personal. Otra de las socias es la señora Ana de 57 años comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Tipitapa y el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de sandías, pipián, cebolla y tomates, y la última socia pero no menos importantes es la señora María de 40 años comerciante de derivados del maíz en el mercado de la localidad.
texts.en: The solidarity group is comprised of three successful members and is coordinated by Flor, 25 years old and in a relationship, who works selling derivatives of corn such as chicha pinolillo and pinol (traditional drinks made from corn and cocoa) in the municipality's market and areas neighboring her community. She has worked in this business for the past 3 years and the loan she requests is to buy a quintal (46 kg) of corn, raspberries, loads of wood, cloves, cinnamon, etc. With the loans, she has managed to expand her business, which has helped her personal development. The other members are Ana, a 57-year-old fruit and vegetable vendor in the Tipitapa market whose loan will be invested in the purchase of watermelon, pipián (a sauce made from pumpkin seeds), onions, and tomatoes. Last but not least, is Maria, a 40-year-old vendor of derivatives of corn in the municipality's market.

loans.use: to buy a quintal (46 kg) of corn, raspberries, loads of firewood, clove, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 33 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jonalyn has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Sapheria

texts.en:
Sapheria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of dry goods, such as curtains, blouses, shorts, etc., to sell in her dry goods business.

Sapheria has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from frozen foods vending.

Sapheria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dry goods, such as curtains, blouses, shorts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 41 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Maribel has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her repair shop. Vicenta is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Vicenta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
El señor Jesús es una persona muy reconocida en su sector por su amplia experiencia de más de 30 años en la venta de frutas y verduras, y desde hace aproximadamente 8 años tiene un puesto de venta en la plaza de mercado de su sector.
Es un hombre amable y siempre con deseos de servir y ayudar a sus clientes.
Con este trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo, y es por sus dos hijos que siempre se levanta desde las 5:00 Am para iniciar con su labor diaria.
El desea ampliar su gama de alimentos y por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar más productos y de esta forma ofrecerle mucha más variedad a sus clientes.
Sueña con una gran legumbrería que sea muy rentable y generar empleo a las demás personas.
texts.en:
Jesús is a well-recognized person in his area for his vast experience of over 30 years in fruit and vegetable sales, and for approximately the past 8 years he has had a stall in the local market square.

He is a friendly man and always wants to serve and help his customers.

With this work he has managed to get ahead with this family, with much effort, and it is for his two children that he always gets up at 5:00 in the morning to start his daily work. 

He wants to expand his range of foods so he is asking for this loan to buy more products and in this way offer much more variety to his customers.

He dreams of having a big green grocery that is very profitable and creates jobs for other people.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of fruits and vegetables to offer more variety to his customers.

loans.name: Rady

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Banteay Meachey province’s Preshnet Presh district, Rady is 41 year old. She and her husband are farmers who have been farming for twenty years to make a living. The current business earns her about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Rady is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en:
Srorn is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in a small village in Prey Chhor district, where she and her husband grow and harvest rice and cassava to earn a living. She has been doing this for almost ten years.

Srorn has applied for a loan of 500 USD to invest in the purchase of farm supplies, such as seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides. She also will use a portion of the loan to prepare the soil for a new growing season. With her profits, Srorn hopes to improve her business to help her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of farm supplies, such as seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, 34, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roshan, who manages their buy-and-sell business, and she is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jean operates a house rental business. It is rented on a monthly basis. She is also helping her husband in their business. She earns a minimum of 70,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales monthly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent. She will also use the loan in the family's buy-and-sell business.

Jean dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her family a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her room for rent and to use it in a secondary business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and widowed with two children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Virginia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been fattening pigs for two years and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products and buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Merlita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: La Paz Centro Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socios laboriosos y lo coordina la señora Anielca de 37 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos, pero solamente tres dependen de ella se dedica a la  elaboración de y venta de derivados del maíz como es nacatamales, tamales pisques y tortilla, cuenta con ayuda de su mamá en la elaboración del producto, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de quintal de maíz, cebolla, chiltoma, ajo, manteca de cerdo, hoja de chagüite, achiote, hierba buena, leña, etc., por medio de los crédito la socia logró cambiar una parte del techo de su casa que ya estaba deteriorado y con este logro se verán beneficiado su familia. Las otras socias son la señora Johana de 30 años comerciante de tomates en el mercado de granada desde hace 3 años, la señora Marta de 47 años dedicad a la hecha y venta de tortilla y güirila en su domicilio, y el señor Wilber de 31 años de edad Agricultor y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de urea, semilla de pipián, granos de chilote. Estos socios han sido ejemplo de superación durante estos tres ciclos que se le han otorgados en esta institución.
texts.en: The group consists of four hard working members and is coordinated by Anielca, 37 years old, married and mother of four children, but only three are dependent on her. She works making and selling products derived from corn such as nacatamales and tamales pisques (types of Nicaraguan tamales), and tortillas. She depends on her mother's help in preparing the product and the loan will be invested in the purchase of a quintal (46 kg) of corn, onion, sweet pepper, garlic, pork lard, banana leaves, annatto, spearmint, firewood, etc. With the loans, she managed to change a part of the roof of her house that had been deteriorating and with this achievement, her family benefited. The other members are Johana, a 30-year-old tomato vendor in the market in Granada for the last 3 years, Marta, 47 years old, who works making and selling tortillas and güirila (thick corn pancakes) in her home, and Wilber, a 30-year-old farmer. The loan is to purchase urea, pumpkin seeds, and corn seeds.  The members have been an example of self-improvement during the three loan cycles they have received with this institution.

loans.use: to buy a quinta (46 kg) of corn, onions, Para sweet peppers, garlic, pork lard, banana leaves, annatto, spearmint, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por  tres socios exitosos y coordinado por la señora Claudia de 32 años de edad, acompañada y con dos hijos que dependen de ella, se dedicada a la compra-venta de gallinas desde hace 4 años, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha tenido múltiples logros uno de ellos es el aumento del negocio, y compra de un electrodoméstico, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de gallinas blancos y colorados, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos por medio del incremento de ventas. Los otros socios son la señora María de 56 años comerciante de gallinas en municipio de Masaya desde hace 15 años y el señor Luis de 29 años de edad comerciante de lácteos como es el queso en el mercado de la municipalidad.
texts.en: The group is made up of three successful members and coordinated by Claudia, 32 years old, in a relationship and with two children who depend on her.  She has worked in buying and selling chickens for the past 4 years. With previous loans, she has had multiple successes, one of which is the expansion of her business, and the purchase of an electrical appliance. The loan she requests is to purchase white and colored chickens, so she can increase her income though this increase in sales. The other members are Maria, a 56-year-old chicken vendor in the municipality of Masaya for the past 15 years, and Luis, a 29-year-old vendor of dairy products, such as cheese, in the municipal market.

loans.use: to purchase chickens by the basket

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan, which she used to purchase merchandise and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Raquel hopes for her business to expand and dreams for her children to finish college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn lives in Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She earns income through providing transportation services to support the needs of her child. She has been doing this for a year, while her husband works as a private employee.

Without hesitation, Annalyn is borrowing a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to renew the transport licenses. She wants to have a better living in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to renew the transport licenses.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 56, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Gil, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Nenita dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a 30-year-old farmer living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She practices farming and sells cocoa to people around her to earn income, in order to maintain her family's standard of living. She wishes to lease many cocoa gardens so that she can increase her output for selling. She wants a loan to buy two bags of cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy  cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Whelma

texts.en:
Whelma is 48 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Whelma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

Whelma has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013. Gina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Gina has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials and pay for construction labor in order to rebuild her family home. Gina is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 32 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Eden is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eden requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eden has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Eden would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Rudy

texts.es:
José, comenta que con el préstamo anterior se ha mantenido trabajando en sus cultivos, ha mejorado su situación económica, la cosecha abundante le permitió tener suficiente maíz, tanto para consumo familiar como para comercializarlo.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, insecticidas y gasolina para la achicadora, le dará mantenimiento al terreno y asegura un buen desarrollo de los cultivos de maíz y pipián.
texts.en:
José says that with his previous loan, he has continued working with his crops, he has improved his economic situation, and the abundant harvest allowed him to have enough corn for family consumption as well as to for sale.

He decided on a new loan to buy fertilizers, fungicide, herbicide, insecticide and gasoline for the generator which will maintain the land and ensure the good development of his corn and squash crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicide, herbicide, insecticide and gasoline for the generator

loans.name: Seynep

texts.ru: Сейнеп 55 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитывают 7 детей. У Сейнеп - средне-специальное образование, по специальности продавец-товаровед, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 35 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сейнеп, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 40 овец, 3 лошади и 5 коз. Кроме животноводства у Сейнеп  есть мельница и трактор, что приносит ей дополнительный доход от оказания услуг местному населению. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет свыше 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сейнеп обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сейнеп планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на обучение младшей дочери.
texts.en: Seynep is 55 years old and a widow.  Since her husband died, she has been raising seven children by herself.  She has a specialized secondary education and is a retailer by profession.  However, for the past 35 years, she has been working in animal husbandry, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. Thanks to her hard work, she currently owns six dairy cows, 40 sheep, three horses and five goats.  In addition to her livestock, she also owns a mill and a tractor and makes an additional income by providing services to the local residents.  She makes a gross monthly income of over 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy sheep and increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of domestic animals.  She also intends to save enough money to educate her youngest daughter.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo es un hombre amante del campo y de su familia por la cual se esfuerza y trabaja infatigablemente día a día.
Y es que este es un hombre que nunca se queda quieto y siempre está buscando el sustento para su hogar a costa de lo que sea.
El trabaja en su propia tierra cultivando alimentos como papa criolla, frijol, repollo y zanahoria, este oficio lo aprendió desde que era un niño pues toda su vida ha vivido en un ambiente campestre.
El solicita un apoyo económico para realizar mantenimiento a sus tierras comprando productos como fungicidas y herbicidas.
Con estos elementos podrá sacar sus siembras con una mejor calidad y esto repercutirá positivamente en sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a man who loves the land and his family, for whom he strives and works tirelessly every day. This is because he is a man who never settles, and always strives to provide for his home, no matter what.

He works on his own land, growing food such as creole potatoes, beans, cabbage, and carrots. He learned this work when he was a child, as he has lived in a rural environment all of his life.

He is requesting a loan in order to carry out maintenance of his fields, purchasing products such as fungicides and herbicides. With these materials he will be able to grow higher quality plants, and this will have a positive effect on his family’s income.

loans.use: to maintain his land in order to grow potatoes, beans, cabbage, and carrots.

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Марине 48 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. У Марины - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1995 году с 20,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию, Марина на сегодняшний день имеет: 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка и 24 овец. Также есть 2,50 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Марина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки коров, что позволит увеличить прибыль от продажи молока. Марина намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Marina is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  She has a secondary education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry, two activities which provide her family with its main source of income.  She started in this field in 1995 with an initial capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her determination and hard work, she currently owns two dairy cows, two young bulls and 24 sheep.  She also has 2.5 hectares of land on which she annually grows beans for domestic use and also for resale.  She makes a gross monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy cows, which will allow her to increase her profits from the sale of milk.  Marina is planning to increase her cattle headcount, which will directly lead to an increase in the family's capital and will help her to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy some cows.

loans.name: Glenda Estela

texts.es: La señora Glenda de 46 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 14 años se dedica a la compra-venta de artesanías, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de jarrones, hamacas, chinos, muñecas de trapos, cuadros, etc., la socia afirma que el éxito de su negocio ha sido vender de contado, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar las ganancias por medio del incremento del inventario con productos que la población más demanda.
texts.en: Glenda, 46 years old, married and mother of a 14-year-old, works in the purchase and sale of handicrafts. The loan that she asks for is to buy vases, hammocks, hammock seats, rag dolls, paintings, etc. She says that the success of her business has been the cash sales. With the previous loans, she has managed to increase her income through the growth of inventory with the products that the people want the most.

loans.use: to purchase vases, hammocks, hammock seats, rag dolls, paintings, etc.

loans.name: Ines Amparo

texts.es: La Señora Inés tiene 22 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en su restaurante  que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Viliroco de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es el primero que ha tomado de con la institución,  La Señora Inés va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frizer para la refrigeración de carnes y vegetales que le permiten elaborar sus comidas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para esta compra que mucha falta le hace en el trabajo, la Señora Inés es una mujer muy fuerte enfrenta muchos retos uno es que  es sola y atiende sola su negocio y  esto le permite mantenerse, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su riquísima comida.
texts.en: Inés, 22 years old, works preparing and selling food in her restaurant, located in the Viliroco zone of the city of El Alto. This loan is the first that she has taken with this institution. Inés will use this loan to buy a freezer to keep the meat and vegetables that allow her to prepare her meals. The reason she asks for this loan is the lack of cash for this purchase that she really needs in this work. Inés is a very strong woman who faces many challenges, one of which is that she is alone and she takes care of her business on her own, which allows her to support herself.  She will use the proceeds of the purchase to buy supplies for the preparation of her delicious food.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Âgée de 45 ans, la dame Fatou fait du petit commerce depuis 2 ans : elle vend de l’encens mais surtout en période d’hivernage ou de froid. Pour ne pas rester inactive, elle a démarré récemment l’élevage de poulets de chair. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin de pouvoir acheter 100 poussins et leur alimentation.
Fatou est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainé et le cadet sont toutes deux des filles. Elle n’a pas de charges sinon une tontine mensuelle dans le quartier.
 Madame Fatou, veut fructifier son capital pour devenir un jour autonome financièrement.
texts.en:
At 45 years old, Mrs. Fatou has been in retail for two years: she sells incense, but business is mostly active during the rainy and cold seasons. To keep busy, she recently started raising chickens for meat. She is requesting this loan to purchase 100 chicks and their feed.

Fatou is married and a mother of four; her two oldest children are girls. She does not have expenses beyond a monthly contribution to a neighborhood business association.

Mrs. Fatou wants to increase her savings to one day become financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase 100 chicks to raise and resell.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr:
Mlle Daba est une célibataire mère d’une fille de 5 ans. Elle fait du commerce depuis maintenant 4 ans. Elle a démarré avec son propre argent, avec un capital de trois cent mille qu’elle a amené en Gambie pour acheter des tissus et des chaussures et venir revendre au Sénégal. Elle fait aussi un peu d’aviculture pour diversifier l’activité. 
Daba habite avec son frère et sa femme, comme participation à la dépense quotidienne, elle achète un sac de riz et paie les factures d’eau. Elle s’occupe de l’éducation de son enfant et de ses besoins quotidiens.
Quand elle a de la marchandise, elle fait le tour de ses clients pour montrer et leur vendre. Daba désire ouvrir une cantine et y stocker sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Daba is single and the mother of a five-year-old girl.  She has been working as a retailer for the past four years.  She started in this business with her own money, a capital of 300,000 CFA francs which she used to buy fabrics and shoes in Gambia before reselling them in Senegal.  In addition to this main activity and to a lesser extent, she is also involved in poultry farming, which allows her to diversify her activity.

Daba lives with her brother and his wife and she helps them with the day-to-day expenses by buying bags of rice and paying the water bills.  She takes  care of her child's education and of her own daily needs.  When she has merchandise to sell, she visits her customers and shows them the goods that she would like to sell.  Daba would like to buy a kiosk where she could store her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Maria Linda

texts.en:
Maria Linda is thirty-nine years old and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Maria Linda is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Maria Linda has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Maria Linda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Serigne Cheikh Mbacké

texts.fr:
Monsieur Serigne Cheikh est un jeune qui a investi dans l’achat et la vente de moteurs de  réfrigérateur. Auparavant, il était à la capitale et vendait dans la boutique de son frère pendant plus de 10 ans. Il a arrêté pour venir à Mbour et changer d’activité : il est devenu frigoriste (métier qu’il a appris après avoir arrêté le commerce).
Serigne Cheikh possède un atelier en face de l’IMCEC et travaille de 8h jusqu’à 19h du soir. Il sollicite un renouvellement de prêt afin de pouvoir acheter 30 ou 20 moteurs selon la taille et la puissance. Il peut revendre ses moteurs directement ou les utiliser lors d’une réparation de frigo en panne de moteur.
Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon, est âgé de 7 ans. Il s’occupe de ses études et de nourrir sa famille. Il ambitionne de renforcer son activité en augmentant la quantité des moteurs qu’il vend.
texts.en:
Mr. Serigne Cheikh is a young man who invested in the trade of fridge motors. Before this, he lived in the capital city and worked as a salesman for his brother, a position he held for over ten years. He quit to come to Mbour and switch career: he became a refrigeration specialist, a job he learned after quitting sales.

Serigne Cheikh owns a workshop across from the IMCEC and works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. He is requesting a loan renewal to purchase 20 to 30 motors (depending on their size and power). He can resell the motors or use them to repair refrigerator with non-working motors.

He is married and a father of two; his eldest, a boy, is seven. He provides for his schooling and for his family’s food needs. He ambitions to strengthen his business by increasing the quantity of motors that he sells.

loans.use: to buy fridge motors for resale.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn is 60 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Samki Meanchey district. Rice farming is the only main source for her family’s income, and she has been farming for about 30 years. To supplement the income, she also sells grocery items. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 60,000 KHR. 

Thorn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and fully paid back the past loans. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Chnnag Province, Samki Meanchey District

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is 59 years old. She is a kind and ambitious woman. Gulbahor is married and has five children. She always tries for the well-being of her family. Her family is big and needs financial support. 

Gulbahor is going to organize a new business, and in this way find additional income for her family. She wants to start a business with selling food items. Food items are always in a great demand in the local market. 

Gulbahor took part in a course, “To Get Ahead”, at a women’s organization. She got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy food items. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three doors, galvanized metal sheeting, and wood to build a roof on the porch where she makes her tortillas and give her residence greater security.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motor to repair his car (405 Peugeot).

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a 56-year-old married mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirty years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Amêvi

texts.fr: Actuellement  à sa troisième demande de microcrédit, Amévi est une coiffeuse avec 14 ans d’expérience. Elle utilisera  ce montant  pour l’achat de mèches et de défrisants pour satisfaire la clientèle de son salon   .Mère de trois enfants, son mari est anesthésiste. Ensemble ils se complètent dans le ménage. Amévi s’approvisionne au marché d’Adawlato et espère tirer un maximum de bénéfice pour continuer à bien mener sa vie.
texts.en: This is Amévi's third request for microcredit.  Amévi is a hair-dresser with 14 years of experience in her field.  She will use her money to buy some hair extensions and anti-frizz products in order to meet the needs of the customers who visit her salon.  She is the mother of three children.  Her husband is an anesthesiologist.  Amévi and her husband jointly take care of the household's expenses.  Amévi buys her goods at the Adawlato market and she is trying to maximize her profits in order to continue to live a good life.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and anti-frizz products.

loans.name: Gerónimo Emilio

texts.es: El señor Gerónimo de 40 años de edad y soltero es propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 6 años y solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos y artículos de uso personal como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, sal, pasta y cepillo dental, jabón de baños, máquinas de afeitar, jabón para lavar trastos, etc., el socio con el crédito anterior logró incrementar el inventario con productos que antes no tenía en su pulpería, esto lo motivó para seguir prestando en esta institución.
texts.en:
Geronimo is 40 years old and is single.  He's had a grocery store in his house for 6 years, and he is requesting a loan to buy consumer staples and personal items such as: rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, salt, pasta, toothbrushes, bath soap, razors, dish soap, etc.  

With his previous loan, Geronimo managed to increase his inventory with products that he did not have before in his store, and this motivated him to continue borrowing from this institution.

loans.use: to buy consumer staples and personal use items to sell

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para surtir de inventario de medicamentos comprara jarabes, capsulas para el estomago, laxantes, vitaminas, etc., con esta compra su negocio mantendrá la continuidad de crecimiento y contara con clientes más satisfechos.
La ayuda que ha tendido de la inversión anterior es un inventario debidamente surtido, aumento de sus clientes, mejor situación económica y un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Juana needs a new loan to stock up her inventory of medicines.  She will buy syrups, stomach capsules, laxatives, vitamins, etc.  With this purchase, she can keep her business growing and satisfy her customers.

Thanks to the help of her previous loan she was able to adequately stock her business, increase her customer base, and improve her financial situation and living standard.

loans.use: to buy syrups, stomach capsules, laxatives, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products (rice, spaghetti, vegetable oil).

loans.name: Taysa Katherina

texts.es: Taysa tiene 28 de edad con un hijo pequeño. Ella hace seis meses empezó a estudiar la carrera de psicología por motivación y apoyo de su madre. Ella eligió la carrera de psicología porque desea ayudar a las personas a corregir su conducta y comportamiento que son indeseables para la sociedad.  Al concluir la carrera ella desea  especializarse en psicología clínica. El crédito lo invertirá en la pensión universitaria. Ella agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Ya que gracias a ello puede lograr una de las metas más importantes de su vida.
texts.en:
Taysa is 28 years old, with a small child.  

Six months ago she began to study for a psychology degree thanks to the encouragement and support of her mother.  She chose a degree in psychology because she wants to help people to correct their behaviors and actions that are undesirable for society.  Upon finishing her degree, she wants to specialize in clinical psychology.  

She will invest the loan in paying university expenses.  She is thankful to Kiva investors for the loan, because thanks to them she can achieve one of the most important goals in her life.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses

loans.name: Chorng

texts.en: Chorn is 26 years old and lives in a rural village of the Storng district.  She has two children. She and her husband are rice farmers and supplement their income by raising pigs. She has been in this business for several years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day.  Chorng is a second cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and use a portion of it to spend on buying pig feed. She hopes to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pig feed.

loans.name: Sonia María

texts.es: La señora Sonia de 67 años de edad y soltera se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas y las comercializa en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace 20 años, tiene tres trabajadores remunerados para la comercialización de los productos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosecha de mango y tamarindo, con esta inversión la socia asegura que aumentará su ganancias y le permitirá reinvertirlas en otras frutas existentes por la temporada.
texts.en:
Sonia, 67 years old, is single and works in the buying and selling of harvests, which she has been selling in the town market for 20 years. She has three paid workers to sell the products.

She will use the loan to buy mango and tamarind harvest. She is sure that with this investment, she will increase her profits and this will allow her to reinvest in other fruits available depending on the season.

loans.use: to buy a mango and tamarind harvest.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 37 years old. She is married with three children. She works as a tailor and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fabrics to make clothes to sell. She plans to use the profits for renovating the house.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yolfa Aydee

texts.es:
Yolfa es una mujer con muchos deseos de progresar y salir adelante independientemente.
Tiene el proyecto de montar una licorera aprovechando que tiene un local desocupado.
Es una mujer firme y de carácter, por eso asegura que quiere que su negocio sea reconocido y respetado por vender productos legales y de buena calidad.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar surtido de diferentes bebidas alcohólicas y para adecuaciones del local como compra de estanterías.
Entre muchos de los beneficios que le brindara el negocio, desea poder darle una excelente educación a su hijo de 19 años pagándole la universidad.
Su esposo es su principal apoyo y siempre la acompañado en los proyectos que planea
texts.en:
Yolfa is a woman with a great desire to make progress and move forward independently. Her plan is to open a liquor store, making use of an empty shop that she has. She is a strong woman, and a woman of character; and that is why she declares that she wants her business to be recognized and respected for selling legal, good quality products.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase an assortment of various alcoholic beverages, and for modifications to the store, such as purchasing shelving. Of the many benefits that the business will bring her, she wants to be able to provide her 19-year-old son with an excellent education, paying for his University tuition. 

Her husband is her main support, and he has always been with her in the projects that she plans.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to open a liquor store and to improve the shop with the purchase of shelving.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique works hard to support her family. Angelique has a live-in partner and has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, varnish, etc. for her business. Angelique has been in this business for seven years now. In the future, Angelique would like to save money to expand her business.
