loans.use: to purchase additional materials like wood, nails, varnish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Slylivia

texts.en: Sylvia is a twenty-six-year-old married woman with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa garden and has been practicing cocoa growing for seven years. She does complain of seasonal changes and competition since cocoa farming is the main business in her town. Sylvia will use the loan to buy more cocoa to sell during this peak season.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell during this peak season.

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.en: Efigenia is sixty one years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them. Efigenia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Efigenia restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Efigenia has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Efigenia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn, 54, is married, and her family lives in a rural village located in the Storng district of Kampong Thom province. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for more than 36 years, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. Khorn joined VisionFund for this cycle and completely paid back her past loans. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Yoern

texts.en: Yoern is 30 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Storng district, Cambodia. All of her children are in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice while her husband is a fisherman. Engaged in this business for over 10 years, they can earn about 26,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  This is the fourth loan for Yoern with VisionFund. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy fishing materials to support her catching fish. She hopes to catch more fish and to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to support her catching fish.

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en: Chreng is a 25-year-old mother of two children, living in a rural village of the Storng district, Cambodia. One of her children is in school while the other one is too young for school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and fishing for almost six years. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day. Chreng is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now, she is seeking a loan to buy fishing materials to support her business. She hopes to catch more fish, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials to support her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 28-year-old man from Kakamega county, which is located in the Western part of Kenya.  He is married to Rose, who is a business lady. He supports four people in his family and has five children who are ages: 13, 10, 7, 5 and 2.

Joseph is a farmer who has a small-scale poultry farming business. He has been doing this for the last 13 years making a monthly income of KES 15,000. He  has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more poultry feeds. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

His dream is to become a large scale dairy farmer and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: It was 1983, when Shahlo was born. Her parents were poor people, so she couldn’t get a higher education. Shahlo’s husband was not so good person and that’s why she divorced. Shahlo is bringing up a child who is seven years old. Shahlo lives with her child. She began her business deal with selling vegetables. She sells vegetables in a local market. Shahlo, little by little, is developing her business. She is going to increase her working capital in a summer season and in this way will attract more customers. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy vegetables for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.en: Leopoldo is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 58-years-old and has four adult-aged children. He cultivates his farm by planting corn and some vegetables for sale. He plans to expand his plantation in order to increase his production. Due to financial insufficiency, he wants to request a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed for his corn farming. Through his patience and strong determination, he believes that someday he will be able to improve his farming business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed for his corn farming

location.town: Brgy. San Juan, Solano, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en: Jenette is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur. She is 44 years old, married, and has five school aged children. Jenette owns and operates a farm and has been engaged in her business for over twenty years. Jenette joined GDMPC and gained access to financial services. It will help to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Recently, she requested a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay for the tuition of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora. She is a 47-year-old resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Artimio. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Flora operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and sells it for a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales everyday.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Flora hopes that her business will get bigger and better and dreams to gain quality customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita helps her husband operates their own farm to make a living. For many years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. She had planned to improve their farm in order to save for their plans of renovating their house. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a fifty-year-old married female with four children, one of whom goes to school. She has been in the bar business for twenty five years, works six days a week and eight hours a day. Her business is located in the rural area, and she also engages in textile farming for additional income. Justine hopes to establish a wholesale business; however, insufficient capital is a challenge she is facing. Justine is a hardworking woman who has asked for a loan to buy more sodas to resell.

loans.use: to buy more sodas to resell.

loans.name: Everardo

texts.es:
Everardo es un hombre fuerte y trabajador, se gana la vida trabajando en la plaza de mercado de San Antonio De Prado, Colombia.
El tiene un pequeño puesto en el vende todo tipo de frutas y verduras que el mismo cultiva.
Lleva practicando esta actividad desde hace doce años buscando estabilidad económica para su familia pues sueña con brindarle a su hija una buena calidad de vida y educación superior.
Actualmente solicita un amparo económico para comprar surtido de frutas y verduras para aumentar su inventario y mantener un nivel de ventas más elevado, esto le proporcionara unos mejores ingresos a él y a su familia.
texts.en:
Everardo is a strong and hardworking man who earns a living working in the San Antonio de Prado, Colombia market.

He had a small stall and sells all types of fruits and vegetables that he grows himself.

He has been doing this for twelve years, searching for financial stability for the family and dreams of providing his daughter a good quality of life and a higher education.

He is asking for financial backing to buy fruits and vegetables to increase his inventory and maintain higher sales.  This will provide better income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Quentire

texts.en: Quentire, aged 54, is a widow with five children. She sells beers and local drinks and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to earn more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beers for sale.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda, 40 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She owns and has operated a retail store in their village for almost eleven years.  She earns a net income of PHP 120 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their daily expenditures. Due to inadequate capital, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase biscuits, beverages, canned goods, and rice grains to sell. She's hoping that her business will improve more to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, beverages, canned goods, and rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala. She is married with three children and all her children go to school.  She has an additional family member (mother). She sells fruits and vegetables. She operates her business on a retail basis from the market. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings to buy onions, cabbages, cassava, fresh beans, cow peas, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes. Her business challenges include selling perishable products and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more onions, cabbages, cassava, fresh beans, cow peas, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en: Marifat was born in the year 1973. She is married and brings up two children. She lives with her family in north Tajikistan. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 15 years. Marifat feeds cows and sheep. She also earns an additional income from growing agriculture products. Marifat is going to increase the number of the cattle she feeds. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Arney

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arney works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Arney is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers for her buy and sell ready-to-wear business.

Arney has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Cheryl requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She has been in this business for 17 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  Cheryl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Khorm

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Koh Krolor district, Khorm is 61-years-old and married. She has four children. To earn a living, she has been farming rice for over 10 years.
 
Khorm has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She is now applying for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 36-year-old married male with two children, one of whom goes to school. He has been in the wholesale business for many years, which is located in a rural area.  Plus, he farms as an additional income. Also, Julius hopes to start up a salon business; however, price fluctuation and limited capital are challenges that he faces. Julius intends to use the loan to buy sodas, beers and cooking oil for selling.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beers and cooking oil for selling.

loans.name: El Me Da La Mano Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias laboriosas, lo coordina la señora Avis de 40 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijas de las edades de 9 y 5 años, quienes son su motivación para su superación, se dedicada a la comercialización de artesanías en los mercados de la capital y de la municipalidad desde hace 4 años, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar el negocio, por tal razón la socia requiere el crédito, para invertirlo en artesanías de cerámicas, candelarias, repujados, hamacas, cotonas, etc., con el fin de seguir creciendo y mejorando la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia. Los otras socias son las señoras Gricela de 50 años quien ofrece el servicio de comida desde hace 9 años en su domicilio y Guillermina de 45 años comerciante de zapatos en el mercado más populoso de la capital y en el de la municipalidad.
texts.en:
The communal bank is made up of three hardworking members. The coordinator is Avis, 40 years old, married and mother of two daughters of 9 and 5 years old, who are her motivation to overcome. She works selling handicrafts in the markets of the capital and the town.

For four years, with previous loans, she has been able to grow the business, and for this reason she needs a loan now, to invest in ceramics, candles, embossed crafts, hammocks, cotton coats, etc. with the aim of continuing to grow and improving the quality of life of herself and her family.

The other members are Gricela, 50 years old, who has been offering a food service from her home for 9 years, and Guillermina, 45 years old, who sells shoes in the most populous market of the capital and in the town.

loans.use: to buy ceramic handicrafts, candles, embossed crafts, hammocks, cotton coats, etc.

loans.name: Martha Aminta

texts.es:
Martha, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para cancelar un pedido de mercadería nueva  de ropa, renovara su inventario con estilos colores y tallas nuevas, comprara faldas, camisas, pantalones, trajes, vestidos, ropa interior y productos lácteos.
Para Martha el crédito anterior fue de mucha importancia en su negocio, porque ofreció nuevos productos a sus clientes,  las ventas y ganancias han mejorado. Su familia está viviendo en mejores circunstancias.
texts.en:
Martha must request a new loan to pay for an order of new clothing that will update her inventory with new styles, colors, and sizes. She will buy skirts, shirts, pants, suits, dresses, undergarments, and dairy products.

The previous loan was very important to Martha and her business because she offered new products to her customers. Sales and earnings have improved. Her family lives in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, pants, suits, dresses, undergarments, and dairy products.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi vend de la bonneterie. Elle a démarré son commerce il y a 14 ans. 
 
Afi  âgée de 54 ans est mariée avec trois enfants à charge.
 
Elle sollicite ce prêt  pour l’achat de soutiens gorges. Afi vend de manière ambulante 

Il s'agit de son quatrième cycle de prêt et son ambition pour plus tard est de se prendre une boutique.
Avec ses bénéfices, Afi espère assurer une meilleure éducation pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi sells hosiery. She started her business 14 years ago.
 
Afi is 54 years old and is married with three dependent children. 

She is asking for a loan to buy bras. She sells her goods on foot. This is her fourth loan cycle and her goal for the future is to open a boutique. With her profits, Afi would like to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bras.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 45-years-old and has two children. Elisa is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Elisa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elisa has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 30-year-old mother from Kisumu County, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She is married and supports four people in her family. She and her husband are blessed with one 3-year-old child.

Rita has a retail shop which she has been operating for the last 3 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. She is taking her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase sugar, cooking oil, maize flour, and soap for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock. Her dream is to educate her children and to increase stock.

loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Yesenia Liseth

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 15 y 4 años de edad y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida mediante la comercialización de antojitos típicos como: yuca frita, empanadas, enchiladas, pastelitos de carne, etc. Es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y trata de dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Yesenia desea construir un cuarto a base de adobe para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de adobes y para pagar la mano de obra necesaria.
texts.en: Yesenia is 31 years old and lives in a home of her own with her two daughters, ages 15 and 4, and her 12 year old son.  She earns a living by selling typical snacks such as fried yucca, empanadas, enchiladas, meat pies, etc.  This is how she supports her household and tries to improve her family’s quality of life.  Yesenia wants to build an adobe room and is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy adobe and pay for labor.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair a room.

loans.name: Yerna María

texts.es:
Yerna es una mujer creativa e inventiva, trabaja en el área de la confección en su propio taller donde fabrica línea propia de todo tipo de prendas y también tiene contrataciones con terceros, su gran respaldo es una amplia experiencia de más de 22 años en este campo.
Genera empleo a otras dos personas y desea que su negocio siempre se mantenga a flote, por eso solicita un auxilio económico para adquirir insumos de confección como tela, hilos, agujas y apliques. Estos elementos le permitirán seguir trabajando con el empuje que siempre lo ha hecho.
Con esta actividad podrá seguir sacando adelante a sus dos hijos.
Sueña con tener una gran fábrica de confecciones, capacitarse en diseño de modas y crear diseños exclusivos.
texts.en:
Yerna is a creative, inventive woman who works in the apparel profession in her own workshop, where she fabricates her own line of all types of clothing; and she also has contract work.  She has a great foundation of more than 22 years’ experience in this field.

She generates employment for two other people, and she hopes that her business will always stay afloat. This is why she is requesting a loan in order to purchase sewing supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, and appliqués. These materials will allow her to continue working with forward momentum, as she has always done. With this occupation, she will be able to continue providing for her two children.

She dreams of having a premiere dressmaking workshop, being qualified in fashion design, and creating exclusive designs.

loans.use: to purchase dressmaking supplies such as fabric, thread, needles, and appliqués.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a 42-year-old married father of two children. He lives in a rural village of the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. He has been in this business for 10 years and he can earn about 44,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

Sophorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely paid back the past loan. Now he is applying for a new loan to buy seeds and pesticides for his farmland. He hopes to make more income from his paddy field.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides for his farmland.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 42-years old and married with one child, who is in school. She resides in a rural village located in the Battambang Province’s Koh Krolor district, Cambodia. For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice to support her family.

Sopheap has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old, married, and has only one child. She helps her husband to gain income by cooking and selling snack foods within her community. She has been in this business for almost five years, and she wants to make it profitable in order to gain a higher income.

She plans to prepare more kinds of snack recipes for her customers but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like a 16,000 PHP loan to buy corn starch, garlic, onions, pepper, vegetables and other ingredients. These are needed for cooking and selling in the local community. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy corn starch, garlic, onions, pepper, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es: Carmen tiene 26 años  de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijas de 6 años de edad. Carmen trabaja como empleada de una empresa de zapatos desde hace 4 años. Ella es una mujer visionaria y muy responsable. Carmen desea construir un baño sanitario y hacer una galera para el baño y lavadero por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como lámina galvanizada, madera, polines y clavos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia.
texts.en: Carmen is 26 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner and six year old daughter.  Carmen has been working as an employee at a shoe factory for four years.  She is a responsible, visionary woman and wants to build a bathroom with a wash basin and is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy the necessary materials such as galvanized metal, lumber, girders, and nails.  She hopes to get this financing and be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a young and hardworking woman. She is 19 years old. Zarina lives with her parents. She learned to sew national women's clothes. She has some experience in sewing. Now, she runs her own business sewing. Zarina serves her clients in her house. She has a little workshop in her house. Zarina manages the business alone. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia is 40 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is still in school. Eusebia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Eusebia has been farming vegetables for 25 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 14 times in the past to sustain it. In the future, Eusebia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 24 years old. She is married with three children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past seven years. She has requested a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Rene

texts.es:
Carlos, se ha visto beneficiado con préstamos los cuales utiliza para fortalecer el negocio, el compro insumos agrícolas que necesitaba en su momento, producto de ello la cosecha fue abundante, permitiéndole surtir en menor tiempo a sus clientes, con las nuevas ganancias a respondido positivamente a sus compromisos económicos y familiares.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas, son de utilidad para que sus cultivos sean abundantes y de calidad, con ello espera aumentar también el aérea de siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Carlos has seen the benefits of loans that he used to strengthen his business.  He bought farming supplies that he needed and got an abundant harvest, which allowed him to dedicate more time to his customers.  The increased earnings have helped with his financial and family commitments.

He is asking for a new loan to buy compost, seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides that will help his crops to be abundant and of good quality.  He also expects to increase his planting area of basic grains and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mohanad

texts.en:
Mohanad is a 46-year-old married man with four children. Mohanad lives with his family in Taiz, Yemen. He studied until secondary school but could not complete his study. Recently, he works as a driver in his minibus.

In the beginning, Mohanad decided to improve the condition of his family by opening a cafeteria. Although he could accumulate a good amount of money from his cafeteria, he found that business unsuitable for him. Then he decided to sell it and purchasing a minibus for transportation. He has started in this business for one year as a driver. Mohanad found this business to be profitable. He works most of his time as a driver.

His bus became old and needs daily maintenance. He earns good profits from this business. Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business goes to repairing the bus, but he does not have enough money for that. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to buy spare parts for the bus, which will save him a lot of money.

Mohanad's vision is to purchase another bus for renting and transportation. He hopes to open a savings account in AMB. He thinks he will buy a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the bus.

loans.name: Linder

texts.en:
Linder is a 28-year-old lady from Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Francis, who is a farmer and supports the family. She supports four people in her family and was blessed with three children who are 13, 11 and seven years old respectively.

She has a tailoring stall which has been operating for the last eight years and generates a monthly income of KES 30,000. She is taking her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to pay school fees for her child's education.

Her dream is expand her business and educate their children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child's education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit (pineapples, oranges, etc.)

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district, Sopheak is aged 28 years and married with two children. For the last 10 years, she has been farming rice and also working as a paid worker. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 27,000 per day.

Sopheak has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she completely paid back the loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 49 years old and supports five members of her family. She is in the dairy farming business in Kapsabet, served by VisionFund Kenya's Kapsabet office. This has been her income generating business for the last 10 years, getting an average monthly income of KES 73,000.

Teresa plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 100,000 to buy animal feed and additional dairy animals for rearing and resale.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional dairy animals

loans.name: Res

texts.en: Res is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself as patient. He operates and manages  a farm, their main source of income. He has been involved in this activity for five years.  He describes his biggest business challenge as the changes in weather. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda operates a farm growing and harvesting rice for sale.  For many years by helping her husband, she has earned a better income for the family. To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase seedlings and fertilizer. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her profits were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting another PHP 10,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to further expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Criselda is hoping to manage additional businesses like a repair shop or a junk shop and she desires to have their own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and married with four children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, beer, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, beer, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, etc.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, beer, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Angel Gustavo

texts.es: Ángel solo se puede describir como una persona carismática esa simpatía y buen humor que tiene para hacer reír a las personas incluso para cerrar un trato de negocio le han servido para hacer que su negocio prospere ya que es muy agradable realizar visita a su establecimiento, Ángel trabaja básicamente en el sector agricultor en la compra y vente de animales específicamente pollos y peces, aprendió su actividad por su familia y desde muy joven ha empeñado todos su esfuerzo para transformar y ampliar un pequeño terreno en algo sorprendente. Su principal sueño es tener una parcela grande, un lugar recreativos donde pueda implantar el habito de la pesca, crear un ambiente familiar donde el compartir de refleje en cada esquina de su predio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como compra de cuido para peces y pollos, adecuación y ampliación de la pecera y construir un gran establecimiento para tener los pollos.
texts.en: Angel can only be described as a charismatic person, friendly and with a good sense of humor that makes people laugh, even to close a business deal.  This has helped make his business prosperous because visiting his establishment is a pleasant experience.  Angel works in the agricultural sector and buys and sells animals such as chickens and fish.  He learned this from his family and since his youth has put forth all his effort to transform and expand a small piece of land into something surprising.  His main dream is to have a larger parcel and a recreational area for fishing.  He wants to create a family atmosphere where sharing is reflected in every corner of his property.  He is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as care for fish and chickens, fix up his fish tank, and build a large chicken house.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Boltaboy

texts.en: Boltaboy is a kind man from a rural area. He is married. His wife is a cleaning woman in a school. His children study well in schools and university. Boltaboy has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 5 years. He feeds cows and has a good opportunity to develop this business as he lives in an agricultural region. His son studies at the university. He studies well. Boltuboy must to pay for university tuition of his son but he has not enough money for it. He is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to pay for tuition of his son. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition of his son

loans.name: Prisila Oneida

texts.es: Prisila tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año de edad. Prisila tiene 8 años de trabajar como empleada doméstica y de esta forma apoya a la economía de su hogar junto a su esposo quien es mecánico. Prisila ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso de su vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como arena, cemento, ladrillo, etc. Confía que con lo que percibe de su trabajo logrará cancelar la deuda mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Prisila is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her one year-old son. Prisila has worked as a housekeeper for 8 years and in this way helps with her home's finances along with her husband, who is a mechanic. Prisila has taken the decision to request this loan to invest in the improvement of her home's floor, for which she needs materials such as sand, cement, bricks, etc. She is confident that with her earnings she will be able to make the monthly repayments that the loan entails.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, etc., to pave her home's floor with bricks.

loans.name: Luz Piedad

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer que ha tenido que enfrentar múltiples dificultades a lo largo de su vida.
Luego de separarse el hombre que era su esposo por problemas con el alcohol por parte de él y maltratos familiares, tuvo la responsabilidad de sostener a su hijo pequeño buscando dinero y trabajo por sus propios medios.
Trabajo en una peluquería en la que exhibía sus artículos artesanales que ella misma fabrica en su casa. Son collares, pulseras y aretes de diversos estilos y colores. Adicional a esto, trabaja con productos de la marca Natura que se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de productos de higiene y cuidado personal.
Ella solicita un apoyo para comprar los insumos necesarios para seguir fabricando sus artículos como nylon y elementos de bisutería, además de comprar productos de Natura para continuar con sus ventas, de esta forma podrá obtener los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento y la manutención de su hijo de 14 años ofreciéndole una educación de calidad.
Sueña con tener un local en el cual pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman who has had to face many difficulties throughout her life.  After she separated from her husband because of his problems with alcohol and abuse, she assumed responsibility for supporting her young son and searched for money and work on her own.

She works in a barber shop selling her arts and crafts that she makes at home.  These are necklaces, bracelets, and crafts of different styles and colors.  She also works with Natura brand products and makes and sells personal hygiene and care products.

She is asking for support to buy necessary supplies, such as nylon and costume jewelry parts, to continue making her articles, and also Natura products so she can continue making sales.  This way she will be able to obtain the income she needs to support her 14 year old son and provide him with a quality education.

She dreams of having a shop where she can exhibit her products.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maritza, vive junto a su familia integrada por su esposo y un hijo, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y reparación de bicicletas, siendo una niña aprendió a elaborar piñatas, ya adulta inicio su negocio de elaboración y venta de piñatas, posteriormente también vente variedad de bebidas, en la zona no posee competencia.
Utilizara el capital para comprar bebidas, papel de colores, pegamento, alambre, pedales, llantas, etc., fortalecerá su negocio y apoya a surtir con algunos repuestos el taller de su esposo, lo que le dará ingresos extras para cancelar su deuda lo más pronto posible.
Maritza aspira a ahorrar lo necesario para comprar su casa propia y ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza lives with her family, which consists of her husband and one son. Her husband works in construction and repairing bicycles. When Maritza was a girl, she learned how to make piñatas. As an adult, she started her business making and selling piñatas. Afterwards, she began also selling a variety of drinks. She has no competitors in her area. 

She will use the capital to buy drinks, colored paper, glue, wire, pedals, tires, etc. She will strengthen her business and will help supply some replacement parts to her husband's repair shop, which will provide her with additional income to repay her loan as early as possible.

Maritza hopes to save enough money to buy her own home and offer her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy drinks, colored paper, glue, wire, pedals, tires, etc.

loans.name: Chinara

texts.ru: Чинаре 43 года, замужем, воспитывает 5 детей. У Чинары среднее образование, с 1992 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 30,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве у Чинары есть 2 дойные коровы, 1 овца, 1 лошадь и 1 коза. Чинара также оказывает услуги по выпасу скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чинара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. А остальную часть заемных средств планирует потратить на полеводство, а именно закупить высококачественные семена ячменя и эспарцета, а также купить минеральные удобрения. Данные мероприятия позволят увеличить доход и дадут возможность накопить средства на образование дочери.
texts.en: Chinara is 43 years old, married, with five children. Chinara has received secondary education. From 1992 she has been working as a farmer. She had only 30,000 KGS as a starting capital. At present Chinara's farm includes two dairy cows, one sheep, one horse and one goat. Chinara also provides a service herding other people's livestock. Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Chinara has applied to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy a cow. She plans to use the rest of the loan for growing farm produce, and specifically to buy high-quality barley and sainfoin [a herb used for animal fodder] seeds and also mineral fertilizers. These steps will allow Chinara to increase her income and allow her to save up for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy seeds of barley

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Tom is a 41-year-old man from Homabay town which is found in Nyanza province in the Western part of Kenya. He is married and supports seven people in his family. He has four children who are 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old respectively.

Tom has a retail shop which has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase maize flour and other shop items in bulk, and he will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

Tom's dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more shop items

loans.name: Bornella

texts.en:
Bornella is a farmer situated in Eldoret area of North rift Kenya where she lives with her husband and 4 children between the ages of 20 and 7 years. She has been doing serious farming for the past 3 years where her primary source of income is milk, eggs, and a retail business.
Bornella chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they give financial aid to small scale farmers. She took this loan for purchasing dairy feeds for her dairy cows. This will give her livestock more energy to produce more milk. Thus her family’s living standard will improve.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feeds

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en: Marichel is 32 years old and married. She was gifted with only one child and they live happily in a rural community. Together with her husband, they aim to improve their status of living in order to give their child a better life. With this regard, Marichel wants to improve her small retail store to generate a higher income. Having insufficient capital, she is requesting for a loan of PHP16,000.00 to purchase more stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, laundry soaps, canned goods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell. She is hoping that she will avail her loan request to be able for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of soft drinks, snack foods, laundry soaps, canned goods, noodles, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a fifty year old married male with four children and all go to school. He has been in the lodging business for seven years, open seven days a week and twenty four hours a day located on a busy street plus rentals as additional income. Nelson hopes to expand business however, shortage of water, power and security are challenges being faced. Nelson is a hardworking and honest man who needs money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y un pequeño nieto de tres años, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado, desde hace 30 años, es un oficio que aprendió de su papá, trabaja todos los días sin un horario establecido.
Comprara ganado y concentrado para alimentarlo, aumentara el ganado que ya tiene y será un potencial para la producción de lácteos,  que le serán de utilidad para mejorar la alimentación de su familia y tener ingresos extras para cubrir otras necesidades.
Su visión es mantenerse trabajando para tener las utilidades  que necesita para cancelar su deuda y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and young three year old grandson.  He raises and sells livestock and has been doing so for 30 years.  He learned this from his parents and works daily without an established schedule.

He will buy livestock and feed, will increase his livestock and use it to produce dairy products that will help him feed his family and provide an extra income to cover other needs.

His vision is to continue working to have the means to pay his debt and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara alarmas, llaves, cables, desatornilladores y otras herramientas para realizar un buen trabajo en su cerrajería. 
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar el inventario del negocio, también ha adquirido más experiencia en la instalación de alarmas, su situación económica es más favorable. La familia se mantiene unida y brindándole apoyo para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elmer is asking for a new loan to buy alarms, keys, cables, screwdrivers, and other tools to do good locksmith work.

The previous loan helped him improve his business inventory and acquire more experience in installing alarms.  His financial situation is more favorable.  His family remains united and give him their support to continue working.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es: Aristides tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Aristides  trabaja como carpintero desde hace mucho tiempo y es así  como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Arsitides solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el baño y el servicio sanitario por lo que desea reparar le techo, pintarlo y cambiar la puesta. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y de esta forma dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Aristides is 26 years old. He lives in his own house with his partner and his five-year-old child. Aristides has worked as a carpenter for a long time and it is how he earns a living and looks after his family. Aristides is requesting this loan from FUSAI because he wishes to repair the bathroom, so he needs to repair the roof, paint it, and change the door. He hopes he will receive this financing so that he can give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, paint, a door, and wood in order to repair the bathroom

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 34-year-old lady from Chepkumia junction in Vihiga county. She is married and supports five people in her family. She has four children. Two of her children are twins aged 17 and the other two are 8 and 6 years old, respectively.

Hellen sells fish, a business she has been doing for the last six years and generates a monthly income of Kes 7,000. She is taking her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to expand her business. She will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to expand her business and educate her children to become responsible people in society.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tyres, patches, additives, detergents, and waxes

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna, ha mejorado la calidad y producción de las hamacas, el crédito anterior le ayudo a comprase los materiales necesarios para que pudiera cumplir con los pedidos existentes, los ingresos han variado pero ha logrado cancelar la deuda y mejorar un poco las circunstancias familiares.
Para ella una manera de seguir ampliando su negocio es a través de créditos, por eso opta por más capital de trabajo con el que comprara hilos (de seda y nylon) y manguios, seguirá trabajando por un buen tiempo sin problemas.
texts.en:
Reyna has improved the quality and production of the hammocks. The previous loan helped her to buy the necessary materials to be able to fill existing orders. Earnings have varied but she has managed to pay off her loan and improve her family’s circumstances a little.

For Reyna, a way of continuing to expand her business is through loans, which is why she is applying for more working capital. With the loan she will buy threads (silk and nylon) and protective sleeves, and she will continue working for a while without problems.

loans.use: to buy threads (silk and nylon) and protective sleeves

loans.name: Ginarose

texts.en:
Ginarose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell of charcoal business.

Ginarose has been in this business for five years. Ginarose earns more income from billiards.

Ginarose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Teang

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Thorm province’s Prosat Balang district, Teang is 34 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice and planting cassava to feed and support her family members. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day. 

Teang is the fourth cycle client with VisionFund and she completely paid back the past three loans. She smartly used the loans to gradually improve her living. Now she is requesting a loan of KHR 1,600,000 to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to grow more rice to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Al Tadamon 14044 Group

texts.en:
Ferial is the featured borrower of Al Tadamon 14044 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends and they work hard to develop their living.

Ferial is 57 years, married and a mother of six children. She has been selling linens from her house for 10 years, to support her husband who works at painting houses with barely enough income to cover his family's living expenses.

Ferial started this business after attending a special vocational training to improve her skills. She decided to start a business of her own because she didn't get the chance to be recruited by a suitable reputable company.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer released collection. She is looking forward to opening her own shop in the future to attract more customers.

Ferial is the second lady from the right with a light purple top. As for the other group members,  Ghada is the first from the right, Nadia is the second from the left, and Ronza is the first from the left.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise for  spring and summer

loans.name: Nematboy

texts.en: Nematboy is a kind man. He is married and has three children. Nematboy has a higher education. He works more than 25 years in a school as a teacher of singing. Nematboy also works in a Cultural House in his region. Nematboy likes his job and works with pleasure. He needs financial support now. His lovely wife is ill and Nematboy must buy medicines to treat his wife but he has no money. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy this medicine. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines to treat his wife

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes and fabric.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 48 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for her family.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like coffee, cereal, juice, sugar, canned goods, and shampoo to sell.

Janet has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, juice, sugar, canned goods, and shampoo. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like coffee, cereal, juice, sugar, canned goods, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es: Iván un joven emprendedor que solo tiene un su mente el verbo trabajar ese deseo insaciable de salir adelante y ser un ente aportante a su barrio, desde muy joven comenzó como empresario realizando ventas en el colegio como dulces con los cuales identifico que ser una persona independiente traía mejores beneficios de los que podría tener como persona contratada, se dedica a la distribución de pan los cuales compra y los vende a familiares, tiendas y vecinos del barrio volviéndose este en su primeros inicios como empresario su mayor sueño es tener una panaderia, poder financiar sus estudios y ayudar con el sostenimiento de su familia aportando cualquier dinero para cubrir falencias o necesidades que tengan. Solicita el crédito para la compra de más panes para distribuir en más lugares comenzó a destacarse en el barrio y lugares aledaños
texts.en:
Ivan is a young entrepreneur who only has the verb 'to work' in his mind. This insatiable desire to get ahead and be a contributor to his neighborhood started when he was very young. He started in business selling sweets at school. With these sales, he realized he could be an independent person. The sales brought more benefits than what he could have gotten as a contract worker. 

He works distributing bread, which he buys and sells to relatives, shops and neighbors. 

Getting back to his start as a business owner, his greatest dream was to have a bread shop, to be able to finance his studies and help sustain his family, contributing whatever money he could to cover shortcomings or necessities they had.

He is asking for this loan to buy more bread to distribute to more places, and start to stand out in the neighborhood and surrounding areas.

loans.use: to buy bread to distribute in more places around the neighborhood.

loans.name: Gs Unidad De Las Flor Group

texts.es:
El señor Juan es una persona emprendedora y muy trabajador, el se dedica a la caficultura o siembra de café, esto lo realiza en su comunidad, desde hace 20 años, el junto a su esposa y sus hijos se han dedicado toda su vida a esta actividad productiva, Juan es muy querido en el lugar donde vive ya que gracias a sus esfuerzos ha llevado mucha ayuda a sus vecinos como la implementación de agua potable en la zona.
Don Juan solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar con paneles, ya que donde él vive es una zona montañosa y hay carencia de algunos recursos, a don Juan este panel solar cambiara de manera positiva la vida de su familia, ya que tener luz en su hogar ha sido un sueño que se le hacía imposible ver, pero ahora este sueño puede ser realizado, el solicita el préstamo con las siguientes personas.
El señor Francisco  se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 15 años.
Melvin se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 12 años.
El señor Ernesto se dedica también a la siembra de café.
Todos ellos sueñan con tener luz en sus hogares.

Danlí, Honduras – mayo  2014
texts.en:
Juan is a hard-working, entrepreneurial person that works in agriculture growing coffee. He has done this work in his community for the past 20 years.  He works daily with his wife and their children and they have dedicated their lives to this productive activity.  Juan is well-liked in the region in which he lives and thanks to his hard work, he has helped his neighbors install potable water systems throughout the area.

Juan is seeking a loan so that he can buy a solar power system and solar panels. The region in which he lives is very mountainous and there is a lack of various resources.  For Juan, these solar panels will positively change his family's life as they will be able to have electricity in their home.  This has been a dream of his that has been impossible to achieve.  But now, he can make his dream come true.

He is seeking this loan along with the following people: Francisco has worked in agriculture growing coffee for 15 years. Melvin has worked in agriculture growing coffee for 12 years.  Ernesto also works in coffee agriculture.  They all dream to have electricity in their homes.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system for his home.

loans.name: Josue Italo

texts.es: Josue tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 10 años y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Josue es jornalero y trabaja muy duro para llevar a sustento a su hogar. Josue solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Josue is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their 10-year-old daughter and 5-year-old son.  Josue is a laborer and works very hard in order to support his household.

Josue is seeking a loan from FUSAI so that he can make repairs to his roof because it is deteriorating. He will use the loan to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails in order to repair his roof.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es:
José, se siente satisfecho con los resultados que ha tenido al invertir créditos en su negocio, la cosechas han sido más abundantes, ha cancelado sus deudas y ofrece a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario, salud.
Se decidió por solicitar más capital para invertirlo en la compra de abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y herbicidas, para preparar el terreno para la próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Jose feels satisfied with the results he has had investing the loan in his business, the harvests have been more abundant, he has paid his debts and is giving his family better nourishment, clothing and health.

He decided to ask for another loan to buy; manure, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides; to prepare the land for the next corn planting.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 52-year-old mother from Kisumu region, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She is married to Jackson who is a farmer and supports the family. Betty supports five people in her family and is blessed with three children who are 23, 20 and 16 years old, respectively.

Betty has a tailoring stall that she has been operating for the last 15 years, generating a monthly income of Kes 10,000. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase cloth materials. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the current business.

Betty's dream is to expand her business and educate their children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials

loans.name: Alejandra Milena

texts.es:
Alejandra es una feliz madre de un niño de 6 años, al cual adora con todas sus fuerzas y vela por darle siempre lo mejor.
Es casada y vive con su esposo que la apoya en todos los aspectos de su vida.
Ella inicio con una miscelánea desde hace mas de 1 año y a tenido buena acogida a pesar del poco tiempo en el mercado y la poca variedad de sus productos.
Ella solicita una asistencia económica para comprar insumos de papelería pues es un elemento que le piden mucho pero que ella no tiene en buena cantidad.
La gran ventaja que tiene es que trabaja hasta las 9:00Pm mientras que los otros negocios del mismo tipo cierran más temprano.
Con los ingresos de su negocio aporta dinero en su hogar y colabora con la manutención de su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandra is the happy mother of a six year-old child, whom she adores with all her heart and strives to always give him the best. She is married and lives with her husband who supports her in every aspect of her life.

She opened a general store over a year ago and has been successful despite the short length of time in the marketplace and despite the limited variety of products. She is seeking financial assitance to buy stationary supplies, as these are products that her customers request but that she doesn’t have enough of  in stock.

The great edge for her store is that she stays open until 9:00 PM while the other similar businesses close earlier. With the earnings from her business she brings money to her household and contributes to the support for her family.

loans.use: to buy stationary supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various items (rice, sugar, vegetable oil, etc.)

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen lives in Kasese, Uganda, with his wife and four children who all go to school. He used his previous loan to buy soda and sugar to sell. For the past five years, he has had a wholesale business located on a busy street, plus he does farming for additional income. Stephen hopes to expand his business despite the challenges of competition and customers not paying on time. Stephen is asking for a loan to buy more soda and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El señor Héctor  tiene 35 años,  el es mecánico automotriz se dedica al arreglo de movilidades,   vive en la localidad de la Guardia donde es su taller, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución va a usar este préstamo para la mejora de su negocio comprando algunos materiales y herramientas que necesita,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tiene mucho trabajo que hacer,  y va a utilizar los beneficios siempre en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para  su negocio es tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a la familia  económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedica a esta actividad ya hace bastante tiempo por lo cual es muy requerido por sus buenos servicios y el desea aprovechar que tiene mucha clientela y así poder pagar este credito .
texts.en:
Hector is 35 years old, he is an auto mechanic and works fixing vehicles. He lives in the town of Guardia, where his workshop is.

This loan is his first cycle at the institution. He is going to use the loan to improve his business, buying a few materials and tools that he needs.

His reason for requesting a loan is that he has a lot of work to do, and he is going to use the profits he makes to continue growing the business.

His desire for the business is to have a better income to be able to support his family economically and thereby improve their quality of life.

He has been in this line of work for quite some time, which is why he is sought-after, for his good service and he wants to make the most of all the customers he has to be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 41 years old and is from Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Margaret, who is a businesswoman, and together they support eight people in their family. They have two children who are 8 and 2 years old respectively.

Fred is a small-scale poultry farmer. He has been in this type of farming for the last eight years making a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his second loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase more poultry feed. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

His dream is to become a large scale dairy farmer and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia has been selling flowers to make a living, and she earns well from this. She had successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to buy more flowers to sell. 

Aside from this business, she also helps her husband operating their own farm, which is their main source of income. To improve their farm, Alicia borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 54-year-old woman from Siaya county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to David who is a farmer, and supports four people in her family. Josephine is blessed with three children who are aged 24, 20 and 16 years old respectively.

Josephine has a business selling new clothes, a business she has been doing for the last five years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more clothes. Josephine will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes material.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz provides for her four children's needs from the little amount she gains each month from her own piggery business. She has had the business for more than six years, as an aid to the income gained from her husband. She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used for feed supplies. So she can continue the business, she is now taking a loan to buy more feed supplies to boost her pigs.  

Beatriz wants to expand her business some day.

loans.use: to buy feed supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, 56, resident of Pasay in the Philippines. She is married to Mariano and a mother of seven children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a tailoring business. Currently, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Virginia's shop mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets and other home wares. She also caters for seasonal demands for clothing such as uniforms, and does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. 

Virginia dreams of having a bigger and better tailor shop. She meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Jedelyn

texts.en:
Jedelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jedelyn is 26 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jedelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jedelyn requested a 11,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like cooking oil, salt, meat, and other items for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jedelyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Jedelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like cooking oil, salt, meat, and other items for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 57 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lourdes has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients and utensils for her business.

Lourdes successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business, which she has been in for 41 years. She would like to expand it to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and utensils for her business

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is 34 years old. She sells potatoes and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

She is very optimistic with her business growth, and she is thankful for the previous loan that helped very much.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is a 49-year-old widow with six children, who all go to school. 

Gorret has been selling soap for three years and works six days a week. Her business is located in an urban area. She is also involved in farming and rentals for additional income. As a loving mother,Gorret hopes to educate her children to university. However the challenge that she faces is inadequate capital. She will use the loan to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, se dedica a vender comida, el negocio surge por la necesidad de contar con ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, en la zona no tiene competencia, su negocio tiene tres años de estar funcionando, su horario es de tres de la mañana a ocho de la mañana. Dora es casada, solo vive con su esposo sus hijos ya son independientes. 
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una plancha para hacer pupusas, plátanos, frijoles, aceite, huevos, arroz, queso, pan, harina, quesillo, chicharrón, etc., incorporara la venta de pupusas para tener mejores ingresos y continuara elaborando los diferentes menús.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para subsistir, tener un negocio más grade que le permita ofrecer empleo y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Dora works selling food, her business arose from the need to have an income to cover her household expenses. There is no competition in her area. She has been in business for three years. Her hours are from three in the morning to eight in the morning.

Dora is married and she only lives with her husband, as her children live independently.

The loan will be used to buy a hot plate to make pupusas [a type of stuffed tortilla], plantains, beans, oil, eggs, rice, cheese, bread, flour, quesillos [a type of tortilla], pork rinds, etc. She will incorporate pupusa sales to get better earnings, and continue making different dishes.

Her dream is continue working to survive, have a bigger business which permits her to offer employment and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a hotplate to make pupusas; plantains, beans, oil, eggs, rice, cheese, bread, flour, quesillos, pork rinds.

loans.name: Savoern

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Samrong Torng district, where farming is a common way to make a living, Savoern is a 52-year-old mother of three dependent children who are in school. Pig raising is the main source of income for the family and she and her husband have been doing it for years. The current business earns her about 30,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day. 

Savoern has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely paid back her past loans. Now she is seeking a new loan to buy more feed for her pigs. She hopes to fatten them up to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is 25 years old and is married. She is from a rural area located in the Samrong Torng district, where farming is a common way to earn a living.

As a mother, she has struggled to feed her family by farming rice and supplementing the family’s income by raising cows. Having been in the business for several years, the current business earns her approximately 30,000 KHR per day. 

Phal has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she is now applying for a loan to buy cows for helping her in agribusiness. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cows for helping her in agribusiness.

location.town: Kampong Speu province, Samrong Torng district

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala. She is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also has additional family members. 

Betty sells fruit and vegetables. She operates her business on a retail basis from the market. She has been in business for the last ten years and works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 100,000 UGX to buy onions, green peppers, tomatoes, avocados. Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to start growing vegetables and to build a house. Betty lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more onions, green peppers, tomatoes and avocados.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 40-year-old man from Kakamega town, which is found in the western province in the western part of Kenya. He is married and supports six people in his family. He has four children who are 18, 16, 14 and 12 years old, respectively.

He has a retail shop that he has been operating for the last four years and generates a monthly income of KES 40,000. He has applied for his fourth loan with VisiomFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase maize flour and other shop items in bulk. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

His dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour and other shop items in bulk

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purchase order cards in the Philippines. Melissa has been in this business for two years now. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purchase order cards to sell.

Melissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more purchase order cards to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Catherine hopes for her business to flourish and dreams of giving her children a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un village dans la commune de SANZANA  dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame MAMINE assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme FOTEMOGOBAN 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare.
